Lead Generation Outsourcing: A Complete Guide
=============================================

Updated On: July 23, 2024

14 min read

![copy-link](https://www.artisan.co/assets/blogs/copy-link.svg)[![copy-link](https://www.artisan.co/assets/blogs/mail.svg)](mailto:?body=https://www.artisan.co/blog/lead-generation-outsourcing)

![Lead Generation Outsourcing: A Complete Guide ](https://www.artisan.co/_next/image?url=https%3A%2F%2Fimages.ctfassets.net%2Fkyprwggh4muz%2F4RSJPHcQvDaZYIVa6KNRnK%2Fd7d1442ccb2398a410bc2137fac44656%2FArtboard_5.webp&w=3840&q=75)

If you’re thinking of outsourcing lead generation, you’re not alone. **By 2030, the outsourcing market is expected to** [reach 512.4 billion USD](https://digitalmindsbpo.com/blog/outsourcing-statistics/)
.

  

Lead generation is vital to growing your business, but your sales team doesn’t always have the capacity – _especially_ with ongoing labor shortages. So, what can you do? Outsourcing can help.

  

Increasingly, advanced AI is assisting businesses in identifying qualified leads at scale without breaking the bank or overtaxing their employees. In fact, [25% of companies report](https://hatchworks.com/blog/software-development/generative-ai-statistics/)
 **that AI helps fill gaps that exist due to a lack of human capacity and** [43% of representatives](https://sellingsignals.com/lead-generation-statistics/)
 **believe that AI positively impacts their performance.**

  
![51](https://www.artisan.co/_next/image?url=https%3A%2F%2Fimages.ctfassets.net%2Fkyprwggh4muz%2Fej8nG5NwbxAU297HICIqp%2F31cb5de7853b8577c7e2f8414e6819a4%2F51.webp&w=3840&q=75)

_From HubSpot’s 2024 Sales Trends Report_

  

In 2024, outsourcing will be a key component of lead generation campaigns, with AI assistance and automation becoming the norm. That being said, outsourcing isn’t right for every company.

  

So, let’s break down the pros and cons of outsourcing lead generation to help you decide if it’s the right choice for your team.

  

Transitioning to Outsourcing: Key Factors to Consider
-----------------------------------------------------

### Defining Your Outsourcing and In-House Lead Generation Models

So, should you keep your lead generation process in house or look into outside lead generation services? There’s no one-size-fits all solution.

  

In-house lead generation offers many benefits, such as:

  

*   ![](https://www.artisan.co/assets/blogs/list-item.svg)
    
    More direct control of your company’s vision and brand
    
      
    
*   ![](https://www.artisan.co/assets/blogs/list-item.svg)
    
    Increased alignment between sales and marketing, which can deepen your understanding of target audiences
    
      
    
*   ![](https://www.artisan.co/assets/blogs/list-item.svg)
    
    Internal teams with built-in knowledge of your company can help better tailor campaigns, draft copy, and produce marketing materials
    
      
    

  
However, maintaining an in-house lead generation team requires significant investments in recruitment, training, technology, ongoing management, and so on.

  

**For small businesses, startups, and others with limited bandwidth, outsourcing can be a gamechanger.**

  
![52](https://www.artisan.co/_next/image?url=https%3A%2F%2Fimages.ctfassets.net%2Fkyprwggh4muz%2F7rXwA8XVcJ36NQ6MnQnsBC%2Fcb996132516b7c9c4d9b063d5785e76d%2F52.webp&w=3840&q=75)

_From McKinsey & Company’s “New B2B Growth Equation”_

  

Additionally, B2B companies in particular may benefit from lead outsourcing. The B2B market is getting tougher. According to McKinsey, B2B buyers’ expectations [have skyrocketed in recent years](https://www.mckinsey.com/capabilities/growth-marketing-and-sales/our-insights/the-new-b2b-growth-equation)
, with consumers demanding more and more personalized experiences.

  

In a hyper-competitive market, casting a wide net is crucial. However, it’s not an easy task when customers expect a customized shopping experience. Lead outsourcing can help by:

  

*   ![](https://www.artisan.co/assets/blogs/list-item.svg)
    
    Specialized agents focus exclusively on finding you quality leads, offloading work from your in-house team
    
      
    
*   ![](https://www.artisan.co/assets/blogs/list-item.svg)
    
    Your in-house team can instead spend time crafting personalized sales and marketing campaigns to appeal to buyers one-on-one
    
      
    

**  
In a nutshell, outsourcing brings in expertise, scalability, and cost-effectiveness. If your company lacks specific resources, outsourcing agencies have access to advanced tools that allow them to execute targeted campaigns efficiently.**

  

Ultimately, the decision between in-house and outsourcing models depends on your unique circumstances and sales and marketing objectives.

  

### Identifying Triggers for Shifting to Outsourcing

Lead generation can be a major bottleneck for business growth. Identifying potential customers can take hours of valuable time away from your sales team.

  

**Are your current resources are unable to keep up with your lead generation needs?** Consider the following:

  

*   ![](https://www.artisan.co/assets/blogs/list-item.svg)
    
    **Do you need to scale lead generation quickly?** Lead-gen scalability is notoriously tough, especially without outside help. In an unpredictable market especially, outsourcing allows you to scale lead generation flexibly as circumstances change.
    
      
    
*   ![](https://www.artisan.co/assets/blogs/list-item.svg)
    
    **Do you want to improve the quality of your leads?** When your sales team is responsible for everything from drafting emails to cold calling, they might not have adequate time for lead generation. Outsourcing can help you better connect with your target market, ultimately increasing conversion rates.
    
      
    
*   ![](https://www.artisan.co/assets/blogs/list-item.svg)
    
    **Do you lack internal resources?** Lead generation is time-consuming, especially with an overtaxed team. If your marketing and sales initiatives are struggling to connect with your target audience due to capacity constraints, you may need to bring in outside help.
    
      
    
*   ![](https://www.artisan.co/assets/blogs/list-item.svg)
    
    **Are you looking to reduce costs?** While many people assume outsourcing is pricey, it can actually reduce costs. Leveraging the expertise and technology of specialized agencies eliminates the need for many in-house investments.
    
      
    

Pros & Cons of Outsourcing Your Lead Generation
-----------------------------------------------

While outsourcing can help with scalability and give your sales and marketing teams extra expertise and experience, it also means sacrificing some control and dealing with potential communication barriers.

  

Let’s take a quick look at the drawbacks and benefits of outsourcing lead generation.

  

### Pros

#### Expertise and Experience

A good outsourcing partner can bring invaluable knowledge to the table. Rather than focusing on all aspects of the sales funnel, you’re working with individuals hyper-focused on lead generation.

  

Service providers focus solely on connecting you with the best potential clients, handing your salespeople those leads most likely to convert.

  

#### Cost-Effective

It might sound cliche, but outsourcing lead generation often pays for itself when it’s done right.

  

When working with a quality agency, outsourcing can improve vital metrics and KPIs while cutting back on costs like recruitment, training, and in-house employees.

  

#### Scalability

As noted above, lead generation can be a barrier to scaling your sales pipeline. If you don’t have adequate time to devote to lead generation, outreach suffers. **Connecting with lower quality leads is a massive waste of everyone’s time and resources.**

  

Outsourcing lead generation allows you to to easily adjust resources based on demand without needing to internally hire or train staff.

  

#### Quick Implementation

Lead generation agencies can get campaigns up and running much faster than in-house teams. The sales process is time consuming. Chances are, your reps have a hundred things on their plate _without_ having to worry about rolling out a lead generation strategy.

  

But an outsourced team specializing in lead generation? **They have the time** **_and_** **resources to implement lead generation efforts fast.**

  

#### Focus on Core Business

With lead generation handled by outsiders, your sales team can better focus on core business needs.

  

Rather than wasting hours crafting an ideal customer profile and identifying key decision-makers to contact, your sales reps can instead spend time honing their people skills, preparing for calls, fine-tuning marketing efforts, and more.

  

### Cons

#### Less Control

First, the obvious – you’re placing a lot of trust in an outside party with lead generation.

  

You’re relinquishing autonomy in decision-making, campaign execution, data management, and more. You may struggle to keep your brand voice intact when you’re delegating tasks to individuals outside your company.

  

#### Quality Concerns

An outsourcing company might bring in a ton of sales leads, but are they the right leads for your goals? If you’re working with an outside company with values that don’t align with your own, you might end up with a subpar list of contacts.

  

Additionally, external agencies sometimes prioritize quantity rather than quality in order to meet contractual quotas.

  

#### Communication Barriers

Effective communication is essential for a good lead generation strategy, but unfortunately this doesn’t always go smoothly. Factors like geographic distance, time zone differences, and even small cultural nuances can impede effective collaboration.

  

When looking for an outsourcing company, prioritize finding a company with values that mesh with your own and be proactive about facilitating conversation.

  

#### Data Security

Let’s be honest – trust is paramount when you’re outsourcing any aspect of your business’s operations. Outsourcing requires sharing sensitive customer data with external agencies, which naturally raises concerns about data security.

  

Handing over data to third parties can increase the risk of security breaches, impacting your company’s reputation.

  

#### Dependency

Intentional or not, outsourcing can create over-dependence on external agencies. **This is a huge strategic risk for businesses.**

  

Relying _too much_ on a third party can limit the development of your internal team, hindering innovation in lead generation over time. Not to mention that if your outsourcing partnership dissolves for any reason, you may be left scrambling to fill the gaps.

  

Choosing the Right Lead Generation Partner
------------------------------------------

The above drawbacks shouldn’t scare you away from outsourcing lead generation. Rather, they should give you a better sense of how to choose the right partner.

  

Below are a few things to consider when picking an agency to collaborate with.

  

### Industry Knowledge and Expertise

**Does an outsourcing company have experience finding leads from your niche or industry?** If not, they’re unlikely to be the right partner for your team.

  

Ideally, you should look for companies with experience working in your specific industry so they understand the messaging most likely to resonate with high-quality leads.

  

Look for hard proof a company is successful in your industry. Case studies, customer reviews, and hard metrics can help you determine if a company’s worth the investment.

  

### Transparency of Strategies

You want to work with a company that is dedicated to transparency when it comes to lead generation. Vague content marketing materials claiming to yield a high number of leads don’t tell you much.

  

Instead, look for specifics:

  

*   ![](https://www.artisan.co/assets/blogs/list-item.svg)
    
    Are companies being upfront not only about their results but how they achieved them?
    
      
    
*   ![](https://www.artisan.co/assets/blogs/list-item.svg)
    
    Are they showing off materials like email marketing templates, LinkedIn posts, outreach strategies, and more to prove they can connect with your ICP?
    
      
    

### Customized Solutions

The best outsourcing companies understand there aren’t one-size-fits all methods. **Companies should offer customized solutions that work for not only your specific industry but your company’s individual goals and needs.**

  

B2B lead generation strategies differ vastly from the B2C or D2C sector, for example. You don’t want a partner who’s a one-trick pony.

  

The best partners:

  

*   ![](https://www.artisan.co/assets/blogs/list-item.svg)
    
    Take time to understand your target audience, brand voice, and brand goals
    
      
    
*   ![](https://www.artisan.co/assets/blogs/list-item.svg)
    
    Have demonstrable experience working with a variety of businesses
    
      
    
*   ![](https://www.artisan.co/assets/blogs/list-item.svg)
    
    Have delivered solid results across a diverse range of sectors
    
      
    
*   ![](https://www.artisan.co/assets/blogs/list-item.svg)
    
    Look beyond conventional lead generation methods and prioritize cutting-edge technologies and out-of-the-box marketing strategies.
    
      
    

### Lead Quality and Conversion Potential

You want a partner that prioritizes quality over quantity (albeit, while also bringing in a high number of leads). A good lead generation partner should have a history of helping companies identify leads with needs that align closely with their offerings.

  

It’s not always easy to immediately gauge an outsourcing company’s skill here. Obviously, reviews that mention quality leads are a great sign, but look into harder metrics too:

  

*   ![](https://www.artisan.co/assets/blogs/list-item.svg)
    
    Can a company provide you information about their lead scoring methodologies?
    
      
    
*   ![](https://www.artisan.co/assets/blogs/list-item.svg)
    
    If you ask hyper-specific questions about your industry during initial consultations, can company representatives answer easily?
    
      
    

  
Asking these questions ensures a company has the expertise necessary to track down quality leads with high conversion potential.

  

### Clear Contract and Pricing Models

We hate to sound like a broken record, but a good lead generation partnership boils down to trust. **A good partner will be completely transparent about their contract and pricing models.** This ensures mutual understanding of your goals, prevents misunderstandings or disagreements, and helps foster a streamlined process for all parties involved.

  

A good outsourcing company should:

  

*   ![](https://www.artisan.co/assets/blogs/list-item.svg)
    
    Clearly outline deliverables, timelines, and the respective responsibilities of both parties
    
      
    
*   ![](https://www.artisan.co/assets/blogs/list-item.svg)
    
    List pricing models both in the contract _and_ on the company website
    
      
    
*   ![](https://www.artisan.co/assets/blogs/list-item.svg)
    
    Let you know _exactly_ what you’re paying for, whether it’s a fixed fee or a performance-based arrangement
    
      
    

### Compliance with Data Privacy Models

Compliance with privacy laws is non-negotiable. The costs can be devastating to both your company’s reputation _and_ revenue. **According to** **_Harvard Business Review,_** **publicly traded companies suffer an average** [7.5% decrease in stock value post-data breach](https://hbr.org/2023/05/the-devastating-business-impacts-of-a-cyber-breach)
 **and audit fees for companies are 13.5% higher post-data breach.**

  

When you’re handing over data to a third party, you need to ensure they’re up-to-date with all regulations and have a solid plan in place to ensure customer privacy:

  

*   ![](https://www.artisan.co/assets/blogs/list-item.svg)
    
    Does your partner have a clear understanding of national, international, and regional regulations?
    
      
    
*   ![](https://www.artisan.co/assets/blogs/list-item.svg)
    
    Can they provide you with detailed information about their data handling practices and security measures?
    
      
    
*   ![](https://www.artisan.co/assets/blogs/list-item.svg)
    
    Are they transparent on their website about these procedures?
    
      
    

### Proven Track Record

Can your outsourcing partner put their money where their mouth is? Anyone can make vague claims about their abilities, but you’ll need to see hard facts before committing. Scan a company’s website and social media to see what materials they have speaking to their efficacy.

  

The more concrete, measurable details the better:

  

*   ![](https://www.artisan.co/assets/blogs/list-item.svg)
    
    Can a company provide you with client testimonials, references, and performance metrics?
    
      
    
*   ![](https://www.artisan.co/assets/blogs/list-item.svg)
    
    Do they have a history of long-term partnerships?
    
      
    

  
You want to work with a company that has a consistent, documented history of delivering results over time and keeping customers happy.

  

How Much Does It Cost to Outsource Lead Generation?
---------------------------------------------------

Obviously, cost is a huge factor for companies considering outsourcing lead generation. So, let’s take a look at how to estimate costs to help you decide if outsourcing is a feasible option.

  

### Cost Per Lead

Cost Per Lead (CPL) [varies greatly by industry](https://www.unboundb2b.com/blog/outsourcing-lead-generation/)
. **Technology and healthcare fall on the higher end of the spectrum, with averages of $208 and $162 respectively. Retail and non-profits, on the other hand, can fall as low as $34 and $31 respectively.**

  

### Pricing Models

Every agency will have [their own pricing mode](https://salesroads.com/outsourcing/sales-outsourcing-pricing/)
l.

  

Some charge hourly rates, **usually falling between $25 to $50 per hour.** Some charge pay-per-performance, where you’re only charged for booked appointments.

  

Costs here can vary a lot by company. **Some companies, usually those that offer customized solutions, work on a retainer basis with fees that start around $8,000.**

  

### Average Cost

Across all industries, **the average CPL comes to** [around $198](https://www.unboundb2b.com/blog/outsourcing-lead-generation/)
**.** However, as stated, some industries are pricier than others. Additionally, high-quality verified leads tend to cost more.

  

### Factors Influencing Cost

It’s hard to make blanket claims about the cost of lead generation. Individual factors make a huge difference. **Everything from the complexity of your campaign to the level of industry competition to your project size impacts your final pricing.**

  

Using AI Sales Agents like [Ava from Artisan AI](/ai-sales-agent)
 can hugely cut back on costs, with fees starting at just $225 per month. [Learn more here.](/talk-to-sales)

  

How To Measure the Success of Outsourced Lead Generation
--------------------------------------------------------

If you decide outsourcing lead generation is right for you, you’ll want to make sure it’s actually cost-effective long term. To measure the success of your outsourced lead generation efforts, consider these key performance indicators (KPIs) and methods:

  

*   ![](https://www.artisan.co/assets/blogs/list-item.svg)
    
    **Cost Per Lead (CPL):** Calculate the cost spent on the campaign divided by the number of leads generated to measure efficiency and budget alignment.
    
      
    
*   ![](https://www.artisan.co/assets/blogs/list-item.svg)
    
    **Lead Conversion Rate:** Track the percentage of leads that become qualified prospects and then customers, indicating the quality of leads.
    
      
    
*   ![](https://www.artisan.co/assets/blogs/list-item.svg)
    
    **Return on Investment (ROI):** Assess the revenue generated from the leads compared to the cost of the outsourcing service to determine profitability.
    
      
    
*   ![](https://www.artisan.co/assets/blogs/list-item.svg)
    
    **Sales Growth:** Monitor any increases in sales volume that correlate with the start of the lead generation campaign, indicating overall effectiveness.
    
      
    
*   ![](https://www.artisan.co/assets/blogs/list-item.svg)
    
    **Customer Lifetime Value (CLV):** Measure the revenue a customer is expected to generate throughout their relationship with your company, indicating long-term value from leads.
    
      
    

The Best Services and Companies to Outsource Lead Generation in 2024
--------------------------------------------------------------------

### Artisan AI

![53](https://www.artisan.co/_next/image?url=https%3A%2F%2Fimages.ctfassets.net%2Fkyprwggh4muz%2F7kKF2bO0JJGZEGKYh404uc%2Fa4999be537e6591c5c3ce84b33ecb20f%2F53.webp&w=3840&q=75)

Artisan AI specializes in creating AI employees, called Artisans, capable of automating entire workflows. Their Sales Artisan, Ava, can automate finding high quality leads, researching them, and writing hyper-personalized emails. [Learn more here.](/talk-to-sales)

  

#### Pros

*   ![](https://www.artisan.co/assets/blogs/list-item.svg)
    
    Ava can instantly find you hundreds of high quality leads
    
      
    
*   ![](https://www.artisan.co/assets/blogs/list-item.svg)
    
    Access to a built-in database of over 300 million high-value leads
    
      
    
*   ![](https://www.artisan.co/assets/blogs/list-item.svg)
    
    More affordable than a human lead-gen agency
    
      
    
*   ![](https://www.artisan.co/assets/blogs/list-item.svg)
    
    Users who have experienced the greatest value from the platform have reported a 7% cold email open rate
    
      
    
*   ![](https://www.artisan.co/assets/blogs/list-item.svg)
    
    Provides a wide range of integrations including HubSpot and Salesforce
    
      
    

#### Cons

*   ![](https://www.artisan.co/assets/blogs/list-item.svg)
    
    As it’s a newer company, it lacks case studies speaking to its efficacy
    
      
    
*   ![](https://www.artisan.co/assets/blogs/list-item.svg)
    
    Some features not yet available
    
      
    

#### Pricing

Prices range from $225 to $875 a month.

  

### Belkins

![54](https://www.artisan.co/_next/image?url=https%3A%2F%2Fimages.ctfassets.net%2Fkyprwggh4muz%2F3UKOU1GpdSvrj0LHFLIWJs%2F65789eb94eb4c76bb11549bea1eaa375%2F54.webp&w=3840&q=75)

Belkins is an B2B lead generation agency that specializes in appointment-setting, cold email outreach, demand generation, sales enablement, and more.

  

#### Pros

*   ![](https://www.artisan.co/assets/blogs/list-item.svg)
    
    Creates personalized campaigns for individual clients
    
      
    
*   ![](https://www.artisan.co/assets/blogs/list-item.svg)
    
    Provides comprehensive case studies, reviews, and testimonials illustrating company’s efficacy
    
      
    
*   ![](https://www.artisan.co/assets/blogs/list-item.svg)
    
    Track record of delivering high-value leads to consumers
    
      
    

#### Cons

*   ![](https://www.artisan.co/assets/blogs/list-item.svg)
    
    Lead quotas not always met
    
      
    
*   ![](https://www.artisan.co/assets/blogs/list-item.svg)
    
    Lack of pricing transparency
    
      
    
*   ![](https://www.artisan.co/assets/blogs/list-item.svg)
    
    Social media outreach limited to mostly LinkedIn
    
      
    

#### Pricing

You can request a quote via Belkins website to get specifics for your company, but pricing tends to fall between $50,000 and $199,000 per project according to Clutch reviews.

  

### Cience

![55](https://www.artisan.co/_next/image?url=https%3A%2F%2Fimages.ctfassets.net%2Fkyprwggh4muz%2F1HiXbOvSqQLZo8F9ZHQZ26%2Fbcd6747afdbb5fbc732b8d7bbc0ba710%2F55.webp&w=3840&q=75)

Cience is a B2B lead generation service that focuses on setting up appointments with qualified prospects. They provide data-driven lists of leads, execute multichannel campaigns, and offer CRM solutions via a HubSpot partnership.

  

#### Pros

*   ![](https://www.artisan.co/assets/blogs/list-item.svg)
    
    Offers customized B2B lead lists based on key data points
    
      
    
*   ![](https://www.artisan.co/assets/blogs/list-item.svg)
    
    Clients report high cold email open rates
    
      
    
*   ![](https://www.artisan.co/assets/blogs/list-item.svg)
    
    Adjusts campaigns along the way for optimization
    
      
    

#### Cons

*   ![](https://www.artisan.co/assets/blogs/list-item.svg)
    
    Mostly provides services for the beginning stages of the sales cycle
    
      
    
*   ![](https://www.artisan.co/assets/blogs/list-item.svg)
    
    Employees based all over the world, sometimes causing scheduling conflicts
    
      
    
*   ![](https://www.artisan.co/assets/blogs/list-item.svg)
    
    Lack of pricing transparency
    
      
    

#### Pricing

Not listed on the website, but ranges from $4,200 to $9,000 per month [according to reviews](https://martal.ca/top-lead-generation-companies/cience/)
.

  

### Hunter.io

![56](https://www.artisan.co/_next/image?url=https%3A%2F%2Fimages.ctfassets.net%2Fkyprwggh4muz%2F45KE5OAyWeHxdleqPvwWbV%2F047c0d104ca0ef39e2c7f0c9bf895fbd%2F56.webp&w=3840&q=75)

Hunter.io is a cloud-based email search solution. It specializes in helping businesses both locate and verify personal email addresses for high-value leads.

  

#### Pros

*   ![](https://www.artisan.co/assets/blogs/list-item.svg)
    
    Provides a wide range of integrations including Zapier, HubSpot, and Salesforce
    
      
    
*   ![](https://www.artisan.co/assets/blogs/list-item.svg)
    
    Instant availability to accurate info on leads
    
      
    
*   ![](https://www.artisan.co/assets/blogs/list-item.svg)
    
    Automates some aspects of cold emailing and communication
    
      
    

#### Cons

*   ![](https://www.artisan.co/assets/blogs/list-item.svg)
    
    Requires a lot of manual labor from your in-house team
    
      
    
*   ![](https://www.artisan.co/assets/blogs/list-item.svg)
    
    Lacks advanced mail tracking software
    
      
    
*   ![](https://www.artisan.co/assets/blogs/list-item.svg)
    
    Occasionally provides outdated or incorrect contact info
    
      
    

#### Pricing

Hunter.io’s paid plans range from $49 to $4999 per month.

  

### Reply.io

![57](https://www.artisan.co/_next/image?url=https%3A%2F%2Fimages.ctfassets.net%2Fkyprwggh4muz%2F2Xayw0LqoHc9ohOTWcLC4H%2Ff379227de3758c22d362e2c99942a373%2F57.webp&w=3840&q=75)

Harnessing the power of AI technology, Reply.io is a sales engagement platform that helps clients automate and scale lead outreach. It provides tools for email automation, drip campaigns, prospecting, and analytics.

  

#### Pros

*   ![](https://www.artisan.co/assets/blogs/list-item.svg)
    
    Provides detailed reports that include campaign information and analytics
    
      
    
*   ![](https://www.artisan.co/assets/blogs/list-item.svg)
    
    You can easily import outside data via CSV files
    
      
    
*   ![](https://www.artisan.co/assets/blogs/list-item.svg)
    
    More affordable than similar options
    
      
    

#### Cons

*   ![](https://www.artisan.co/assets/blogs/list-item.svg)
    
    Customized fields can be difficult to import
    
      
    
*   ![](https://www.artisan.co/assets/blogs/list-item.svg)
    
    Lack of editing options for email design
    
      
    
*   ![](https://www.artisan.co/assets/blogs/list-item.svg)
    
    UX design is sometimes confusing
    
      
    

#### Pricing

Reply.io’s paid plans range from $49 to $139 per month

  

**Start generating leads 10 minutes from now.** [Hire Ava now](/ai-sales-agent)
**, and she will launch a lead generation campaign for you immediately with a focus on quality leads and quick results**.

  

Outsourcing Lead Generation: The Bottom Line
--------------------------------------------

Outsourcing lead generation is likely to become more common in 2024 and beyond. With the rise of AI especially, we’re likely to see more and more lead generation solutions crop up on the market. If you’re considering outsourcing lead generation, do your due diligence before settling on a partner.

  

**The best lead generation outsourcing companies provide customized solutions tailored to your industry and niche.** They’re transparent about everything from pricing to data compliance and can provide hard evidence that their methods work.

  

While outsourcing presents its challenges, thorough research helps you find the right partner and achieve growth in today’s competitive landscape.

content:
[![artisan-logo](https://www.artisan.co/_next/image?url=%2Fassets%2Fartisan-primary-logo.webp&w=64&q=75)![artisan-logo](https://www.artisan.co/_next/image?url=%2Fassets%2Fartisan-text-logo.webp&w=256&q=75)](/) Products Solutions Resources [Pricing](/pricing) [Enterprise](/solutions/enterprise) [Login](https://app.artisan.co/login) Contact Sales Sales Top 10 Apollo Alternatives | Pricing, Features, Response Rates ============================================================== Updated On: July 23, 2024 14 minutes read ![copy-link](https://www.artisan.co/assets/blogs/copy-link.svg)[![copy-link](https://www.artisan.co/assets/blogs/mail.svg)](mailto:?body=https://www.artisan.co/blog/apollo-alternatives) ![Top 10 Apollo Alternatives | Pricing, Features, Response Rates](https://www.artisan.co/_next/image?url=https%3A%2F%2Fimages.ctfassets.net%2Fkyprwggh4muz%2FtThIzALNNJRnpvrieiRRn%2F35c233cd1d0dc246e45a000196ee1e86%2FArtboard_1.webp&w=3840&q=75) Apollo has rocketed in popularity over the last few years. Ranked among the market leaders in numerous categories on G2, there’s no doubt it’s a powerful platform.   But it’s not without its drawbacks.  Whatever your reasons for searching for an alternative, whether it’s Apollo’s price, complex dashboard and steep learning curve, lead data accuracy, or limited AI functionality, we’ve got your back.  We’ve covered the top alternatives to Apollo, from enterprise-level market leaders like ZoomInfo to fresh-off-the-line, AI-first companies like Artisan. And don’t worry, we’re not going to make it all about comparing the sizes of databases. We’re just going to make it a little bit about that.  Apollo Alternatives: Quick Comparison ------------------------------------- ![Apollo Comparison](https://www.artisan.co/_next/image?url=https%3A%2F%2Fimages.ctfassets.net%2Fkyprwggh4muz%2F5miaFBpW7PEgacNEtvtN5b%2F6d26a14879b3e71c798d80bbec4ef640%2F2.webp&w=3840&q=75) Here’s the ten-second breakdown of the top Apollo alternatives and what you can expect in terms of key features and pricing. We recommend reading the full article for a thorough understanding of your options, but this table will give you a solid overview of the market.  | | | | | | | --- | --- | --- | --- | --- | | **Company** | **Key Features** | **Pros** | **Cons** | **Pricing (Monthly)** | | Artisan | AI functionality



Lead database (300M+)



Workflow automation | Comprehensive platform



Automation for all stages



Built-in hallucination checks | Some missing features as early-stage startup



Expensive for smaller companies | Custom | | ZoomInfo | Customizable enterprise tools



Lead database



Integrations library | Many enterprise features



Easy-to-use interface



Numerous integrations | Expensive



Limited AI functionality



Unresponsive customer service | Custom | | HubSpot Sales Hub | Sales engagement sequences



Lead scoring



CRM integration | Integrates with HubSpot CRM



Meeting scheduler



Easy-to-use platform | No lead database



Limited AI functionality



Per-user pricing can add up | $20 - $150 | | LinkedIn Sales Navigator | Lead database (60M+)



Intent tracking



Integrations library | Useful for manual LinkedIn outreach



High-quality lead data



Integrates with main CRMs | Small database



Limited automation and AI functionality



Most advanced features require custom plan | $99 - $169.99 | | Lusha | Lead database (50M+)




Intent filter



Workflow automation | Transparent pricing





Emphasis on GDPR-compliant data



Simple platform | Phone data requires credits



Few segmentation features



Lack of AI functionality | $49 - $79 | | Seamless AI | AI-enriched lead database



Workflow automation



Lead search engine | Strong AI functionality



Automation tools



Lead search engine | Credit-based structure



Limited customer support



Many advanced features only on higher-tier plans | ~$150 | | Hunter | Email search tool



Campaign automation



Integrations | Good email data accuracy



Unlimited users



Browser add-on | No phone data



Restrictions on searches



Limited automation and AI features | $49 - $499 | | Rocket- Reach | Leads database (700M+)



Intent signals



API | Large lead database



Well-priced individual plans



Email automation | Questionable database quality



Requires annual plan for unlimited data



Limited integrations | $39 - $349 | | Lead411 | Unlimited data access



Intent signals



Outreach management | Large database



CRM integrations



Chrome extension | Expensive



Few integrations



Intent data not on all plans | $99 | | Pipedrive | Outreach management



Analytics



Large library of integrations | Powerful platform



Growing AI functionality



Many integrations | No lead database



Convoluted pricing



Still early for AI functionality | $14 - $99 | Now you know what’s on offer, let’s jump into detailed reviews of the leading Apollo alternatives and find the one that's the perfect fit for your business.  1\. Artisan ----------- ![Artisan Homepage Screenshot](https://www.artisan.co/_next/image?url=https%3A%2F%2Fimages.ctfassets.net%2Fkyprwggh4muz%2F3iMLW1oB3n7XEZwVilgwp7%2F5dde3325aea1873626267f74024f3ae2%2FScreenshot__686_.png&w=3840&q=75) Artisan is an AI-first, all-in-one outbound sales automation and lead gen platform. Unlike the other entries on this list, AI is baked right into the core of the software in a very nuanced and wide-reaching way.  Artisan’s AI engine is a human-like “employee” called Ava. She’s a virtual business development representative (BDR) who can automate 80% of the outbound sales process and will get your first campaign up and running over the course of a 10-minute conversation.  Ava puts together your ideal customer profile, prospects the Artisan database of over 300 million contacts, filters and enriches the leads, and crafts and sends bespoke email sequences. You can also, of course, access features manually where appropriate and have full control over what’s automated. ![Ava for Apollo](https://www.artisan.co/_next/image?url=https%3A%2F%2Fimages.ctfassets.net%2Fkyprwggh4muz%2F2ZnS0QSbrGWM95zT0rbxV%2F83478b5bc6f3a267fd151b2e6919e124%2F4.webp&w=3840&q=75) ### Key Features * ![](https://www.artisan.co/assets/blogs/list-item.svg) **Baked-in AI engine.** Artisan’s AI sales development representative (SDR), Ava, streamlines and improves every part of the outbound sales process, from campaign setup to the actual outreach itself.  * ![](https://www.artisan.co/assets/blogs/list-item.svg) **Lead database.** Apollo’s database has over 300 million leads across 200 countries with up-to-date and fully enriched lead data.  * ![](https://www.artisan.co/assets/blogs/list-item.svg) **Web scraping.** Ava collects data points from a wide set of sources, including company websites and social media like LinkedIn and Twitter.  * ![](https://www.artisan.co/assets/blogs/list-item.svg) **Workflow replication.** Already have successful outbound sales workflows? Excellent. Ava can replicate and automate them in Artisan by building a dedicated playbook for your target outreach and email sequences.  * ![](https://www.artisan.co/assets/blogs/list-item.svg) **Email automation.** Artisan’s email outreach tools are fully automated, with timezone tracking, translation, bounce testing, and dynamic send limits baked in. Send follow-up emails, receive notifications about interested leads, and manage responses via the intuitive email dashboard.  * ![](https://www.artisan.co/assets/blogs/list-item.svg) **Email warmup.** Built-in email warmup service ensures that your mailboxes are prepped and ready to go without fear of penalties. No need to pay for a dedicated third-party warmup service.  * ![](https://www.artisan.co/assets/blogs/list-item.svg) **Analytics.** You’ll have access to comprehensive data about your campaigns with metrics like lead response rate, mailbox health, most successful campaigns, and more.  ![Ava-Apollo-5](https://www.artisan.co/_next/image?url=https%3A%2F%2Fimages.ctfassets.net%2Fkyprwggh4muz%2F5nXKlYy1QssFZBASR9OY1s%2F9a20d4c40833038dbed95104161d7d83%2F5.webp&w=3840&q=75) ### Pricing Artisan pricing varies based on the lead volume and customization required. However, you’ll get one-on-one onboarding, and there’s no charge until your campaign is firing on all cylinders (so you’re not worrying about idle time).  For a pricing consultation and to learn how Ava can boost your sales enablement, reach out to Artisan’s sales team. ### Pros * ![](https://www.artisan.co/assets/blogs/list-item.svg) Uses active web scraping and AI enrichment to identify a wide range of lead data points including intent and technographic data * ![](https://www.artisan.co/assets/blogs/list-item.svg) Comprehensive platform for all aspects of sales outreach * ![](https://www.artisan.co/assets/blogs/list-item.svg) Automation for every stage of your outbound workflow * ![](https://www.artisan.co/assets/blogs/list-item.svg) Automates email writing based on successful email playbooks and emulation of true human style * ![](https://www.artisan.co/assets/blogs/list-item.svg) Built-in hallucination checks to prevent AI-related mistakes * ![](https://www.artisan.co/assets/blogs/list-item.svg) At the forefront of AI to create hyper-personalized research, enrichment, and outreach workflows ### Cons * ![](https://www.artisan.co/assets/blogs/list-item.svg) As an early-stage startup, some features are missing (though Artisan is growing very quickly, and new functionality is being added weekly) * ![](https://www.artisan.co/assets/blogs/list-item.svg) Expensive for smaller companies compared to more basic automation software 2\. ZoomInfo ------------ ![ZoomInfo](https://www.artisan.co/_next/image?url=https%3A%2F%2Fimages.ctfassets.net%2Fkyprwggh4muz%2F6WAdf9EteeoDUecf5rrpRg%2F1443965886aa1b9085f06e22dd953b09%2FScreenshot__688_.png&w=3840&q=75) ZoomInfo is a B2B sales intelligence and outreach platform that also provides a layer of engagement tools, such as web chat and web form optimization. It’s aimed at B2B enterprises and boasts a solid database of B2B data. In addition to the desktop app, users can also take advantage of a Chrome extension for prospecting on the go.  ### Key features * ![](https://www.artisan.co/assets/blogs/list-item.svg) **Customizable enterprise tools.** Leverage APIs and data-as-a-service (DaaS) options to customize enterprise solutions.  * ![](https://www.artisan.co/assets/blogs/list-item.svg) **Lead database.** Access a large database of prospects with automated enrichment and segmentation. * ![](https://www.artisan.co/assets/blogs/list-item.svg) **Integrations library.** Integrate with many third-party platforms like AWS and Snowflake.  * ![](https://www.artisan.co/assets/blogs/list-item.svg) **Automation.** Automate email sequences and parts of the phone outreach process.  ### Pricing Pricing isn’t publicly available. Users indicate that pricing is at the enterprise level and expensive compared to other providers.  ### Pros * ![](https://www.artisan.co/assets/blogs/list-item.svg) Large set of enterprise-level features, including APIs * ![](https://www.artisan.co/assets/blogs/list-item.svg) Interface is easy to configure and use * ![](https://www.artisan.co/assets/blogs/list-item.svg) A large set of integrations with third-party solutions ### Cons * ![](https://www.artisan.co/assets/blogs/list-item.svg) Analysis of user reviews indicates that the platform is expensive * ![](https://www.artisan.co/assets/blogs/list-item.svg) Limited AI functionality  * ![](https://www.artisan.co/assets/blogs/list-item.svg) There are many complaints about unresponsive customer service 3\. HubSpot Sales Hub --------------------- ![HubSpot](https://www.artisan.co/_next/image?url=https%3A%2F%2Fimages.ctfassets.net%2Fkyprwggh4muz%2F7beNOHp5ZeejOaz5AOigD0%2Fdb76114e44a9d602c244e8603d4d70e0%2FScreenshot__689_.png&w=3840&q=75) Ah, good ol’ HubSpot. It seems that nowadays, no software review is complete without HubSpot getting at least a passing mention.  Sales Hub is a standalone solution (although it does, of course, integrate with the HubSpot CRM) and has pricing tiers that cater to the whole spectrum of business users, from solopreneurs to multinational enterprises.  ### Key features * ![](https://www.artisan.co/assets/blogs/list-item.svg) **Sales engagement sequences.** Build and automate email outreach sequences.  * ![](https://www.artisan.co/assets/blogs/list-item.svg) **Lead scoring.** Score and track the progress of your leads.  * ![](https://www.artisan.co/assets/blogs/list-item.svg) **CRM integration.** Integrate Sales Hub easily with your HubSpot CRM if you use it.  ### Pricing Hubspot has three pricing tiers and a free plan. The “Starter” package is **$20/month per user**, the “Professional” package is **$100/month per user**, and the “Enterprise” package is **$150/month** per user.  ### Pros * ![](https://www.artisan.co/assets/blogs/list-item.svg) Integrates directly with the broader HubSpot CRM * ![](https://www.artisan.co/assets/blogs/list-item.svg) Includes a meeting scheduler and invoicing tools  * ![](https://www.artisan.co/assets/blogs/list-item.svg) Easy-to-use platform and large community    ### Cons * ![](https://www.artisan.co/assets/blogs/list-item.svg) No lead database  * ![](https://www.artisan.co/assets/blogs/list-item.svg) AI functionality is limited to writing emails * ![](https://www.artisan.co/assets/blogs/list-item.svg) Per-user pricing can quickly add up  4\. LinkedIn Sales Navigator ---------------------------- ![LinkedIn Sales](https://www.artisan.co/_next/image?url=https%3A%2F%2Fimages.ctfassets.net%2Fkyprwggh4muz%2F3TUUXBsBvJszciW6TQrReG%2F9f7681d2a69d2ecb2bd411554d98c77b%2FScreenshot__690_.png&w=3840&q=75) LinkedIn Sales Navigator is one of the most popular sales prospecting tools, largely by virtue of the fact LinkedIn can advertise to virtually every sales professional on the planet.  Automation features are limited, and, perhaps counterintuitively, its database is relatively small compared to other providers because it only provides access to individuals and companies with profiles.  ### Key features * ![](https://www.artisan.co/assets/blogs/list-item.svg) **Lead database.** Access a database of around 60 million LinkedIn users.  * ![](https://www.artisan.co/assets/blogs/list-item.svg) **Intent tracking.** Filter leads based on signals like job changes and profile visits.  * ![](https://www.artisan.co/assets/blogs/list-item.svg) **Integrations library.** Integrate with top CRMs like HubSpot and Salesforce.  ### Pricing Sales Navigator “Core” costs **$99/month,** and Sales Navigator “Advanced” costs **$169.99/month**. A custom plan with additional features is also available.  ### Pros * ![](https://www.artisan.co/assets/blogs/list-item.svg) Useful for manual LinkedIn outreach of warm prospects * ![](https://www.artisan.co/assets/blogs/list-item.svg) High-quality lead data  * ![](https://www.artisan.co/assets/blogs/list-item.svg) Integrates with the main CRMs ### Cons * ![](https://www.artisan.co/assets/blogs/list-item.svg) Small database * ![](https://www.artisan.co/assets/blogs/list-item.svg) Limited automation and AI functionality  * ![](https://www.artisan.co/assets/blogs/list-item.svg) Most advanced features require a custom plan 5\. Lusha --------- ![Lusha](https://www.artisan.co/_next/image?url=https%3A%2F%2Fimages.ctfassets.net%2Fkyprwggh4muz%2F6Oqg3EuNl6qehQSW2tLHDC%2F9616b2dcce0ea465ae8065766dc36801%2FScreenshot__691_.png&w=3840&q=75) Lusha is a rising star in the sales prospecting space. It’s garnering a reputation as a solid source of email contact data—with rigorous email verification criteria—but has mixed reviews when it comes to phone numbers.  ### Key features * ![](https://www.artisan.co/assets/blogs/list-item.svg) **Lead database:** Prospect from a database of 50 million enterprise accounts, with many GDPR-compliant leads.  * ![](https://www.artisan.co/assets/blogs/list-item.svg) **Intent filter.** Track intent and lead readiness with behavioral data.  * ![](https://www.artisan.co/assets/blogs/list-item.svg) **Workflow automation.** Automate email sequences and lead identification.  * ![](https://www.artisan.co/assets/blogs/list-item.svg) **LinkedIn browser extension.** Prospect from LinkedIn while browsing.  ### Pricing Lusha has two paid tiers in addition to free and custom plans. The “Pro” plan is **$49/month** per user, and the “Premium” plan is **$79/month** per user.  ### Pros * ![](https://www.artisan.co/assets/blogs/list-item.svg) Transparent pricing for smaller companies  * ![](https://www.artisan.co/assets/blogs/list-item.svg) Emphasis on GDPR-compliant data  * ![](https://www.artisan.co/assets/blogs/list-item.svg) Simple and intuitive platform ### Cons * ![](https://www.artisan.co/assets/blogs/list-item.svg) Phone data requires credits * ![](https://www.artisan.co/assets/blogs/list-item.svg) Few segmentation features * ![](https://www.artisan.co/assets/blogs/list-item.svg) Lack of AI functionality 6\. Seamless.AI --------------- ![Seamless.AI](https://www.artisan.co/_next/image?url=https%3A%2F%2Fimages.ctfassets.net%2Fkyprwggh4muz%2F4sTfWwrH1eidqzOGs9wWHg%2F267457767137048e5bf6162f6e4655e0%2FScreenshot__692_.png&w=3840&q=75) Seamless.AI places AI functionality at the core of its platform, using it to verify and enrich B2B contact data and lead lists and automate cold email outreach.  It works on a lead credit basis, so there will be limits on how much outreach you can conduct if you opt for Seamless.AI.  ### **Key features** * ![](https://www.artisan.co/assets/blogs/list-item.svg) **AI-enriched lead database.** Access a large database of prospects with AI-enriched data.  * ![](https://www.artisan.co/assets/blogs/list-item.svg) **Workflow automation.** Send automated email outreach and follow-up with emails written by AI. * ![](https://www.artisan.co/assets/blogs/list-item.svg) **Lead search engine.** Search directly for leads using the prospect “real-time search engine.” ### Pricing Seamless.AI offers a free trial with 50 credits. Contact sales to learn about pricing for the “Basic,” “Pro,” and “Enterprise” plans. User reviews indicate that pricing starts at approximately **$150/month**.   ### Pros * ![](https://www.artisan.co/assets/blogs/list-item.svg) Strong AI functionality * ![](https://www.artisan.co/assets/blogs/list-item.svg) Automation tools for email sequences * ![](https://www.artisan.co/assets/blogs/list-item.svg) Lead search engine for finding individual sales leads ### Cons * ![](https://www.artisan.co/assets/blogs/list-item.svg) Credit-based structure, which can restrict outreach * ![](https://www.artisan.co/assets/blogs/list-item.svg) Limited customer support on “Basic” plan * ![](https://www.artisan.co/assets/blogs/list-item.svg) Many advanced features like intent signals are only available on the “Pro” plan and above 7\. Hunter ---------- ![Hunter](https://www.artisan.co/_next/image?url=https%3A%2F%2Fimages.ctfassets.net%2Fkyprwggh4muz%2F5Z4JabrLAXzZGoZNPOOGDz%2F46a0bb8850bd0b7ae82193b1655d066d%2FScreenshot__693_.png&w=3840&q=75) Email is Hunter’s thing. It’s a good Apollo’s alternative but focused on near-exclusively email, with little additional lead data.  While Hunter does have discovery and prospecting features, it’s better understood as an email finder rather than a sales outreach one. It’s a potential option for smaller businesses without complex prospecting requirements.  ### Key features * ![](https://www.artisan.co/assets/blogs/list-item.svg) **Email search tool.** Search for email addresses at target companies and run email verification.  * ![](https://www.artisan.co/assets/blogs/list-item.svg) **Campaign automation.** Run semi-automated email campaigns on the platform.  * ![](https://www.artisan.co/assets/blogs/list-item.svg) **Integrations.** Integrate with the most popular CRMs and use the browser extension to enhance prospecting.  ### Pricing Hunter has a free plan with 25/searches per month. The “Starter” plan is **$49.00/month**, the “Growth” plan is **$149/month**, and the “Business” plan is **$499/month**. Hunter also has an enterprise tier.  ### Pros * ![](https://www.artisan.co/assets/blogs/list-item.svg) Good email data accuracy * ![](https://www.artisan.co/assets/blogs/list-item.svg) Unlimited users (limits are based on monthly searches) * ![](https://www.artisan.co/assets/blogs/list-item.svg) Browser add-on ### Cons * ![](https://www.artisan.co/assets/blogs/list-item.svg) No phone data * ![](https://www.artisan.co/assets/blogs/list-item.svg) Restrictions on the number of email searches per month * ![](https://www.artisan.co/assets/blogs/list-item.svg) Limited automation and AI features 8\. RocketReach --------------- ![RocketReach](https://www.artisan.co/_next/image?url=https%3A%2F%2Fimages.ctfassets.net%2Fkyprwggh4muz%2F1eVqG3pYcUINUtcHBqZHy6%2F5a25b225d02b6232002678ecf79efec4%2FScreenshot__694_.png&w=3840&q=75) RocketReach has a colossal database of 700 million leads and a strong set of lead-generation automation features.  That said, users have raised concerns about the quality of B2B email and direct dials. In addition, to access unlimited data, you need to subscribe to an annual plan.  ### Key features * ![](https://www.artisan.co/assets/blogs/list-item.svg) **Leads database.** Access a huge database of 700 million leads. * ![](https://www.artisan.co/assets/blogs/list-item.svg) **Intent signals.** Tailor outreach to target individuals with strong buyer intent.  * ![](https://www.artisan.co/assets/blogs/list-item.svg) **API.** Rocket offers an API for enterprise use.  ### Pricing RocketReach offers a range of pricing tiers from **$39.00/month** (individual plan) to **$349/month** per user (team plan). You’ll need to purchase an annual plan for unlimited lead data.  ### Pros * ![](https://www.artisan.co/assets/blogs/list-item.svg) Large lead database * ![](https://www.artisan.co/assets/blogs/list-item.svg) Well-priced individual plans * ![](https://www.artisan.co/assets/blogs/list-item.svg) Email automation ### Cons * ![](https://www.artisan.co/assets/blogs/list-item.svg) The database is of questionable quality based on user reviews * ![](https://www.artisan.co/assets/blogs/list-item.svg) Forces you to purchase the annual plan to unlock features * ![](https://www.artisan.co/assets/blogs/list-item.svg) A limited number of integrations 9\. Lead411 ----------- ![lead411](https://www.artisan.co/_next/image?url=https%3A%2F%2Fimages.ctfassets.net%2Fkyprwggh4muz%2F192tPqlUyqMjGctuefOszD%2Ff5c103cabee542529dcbbe37cb3551ac%2FScreenshot__696_.png&w=3840&q=75) Lead411 bills itself as the _only_ unlimited B2B data prospecting tool. That’s not quite true—other services don’t cap the amount of lead data you can access—but it does have a pretty sizable database of over 450 million.  Lead411 has added outreach tools for running email campaigns directly to the platform and also offers intent data on its premium plans.  ### **Key features** * ![](https://www.artisan.co/assets/blogs/list-item.svg) **Unlimited data access.** Gather as much lead data (emails and phone numbers) as you want without any limits.  * ![](https://www.artisan.co/assets/blogs/list-item.svg) **Intent signals.** Track intent signals and score B2B leads (only available on the higher-tier plan).  * ![](https://www.artisan.co/assets/blogs/list-item.svg) **Outreach management.** Run email campaigns on the platform, including SMS outreach. ### Pricing Lead411’s “Basic Plus Unlimited” plan costs **$99/month per user**. Intent data is available on the annual “Pro” and “Unlimited” packages. Contact sales for pricing. A free trial is available.  ### Pros * ![](https://www.artisan.co/assets/blogs/list-item.svg) Large database with unlimited access * ![](https://www.artisan.co/assets/blogs/list-item.svg) Integrations with top CRMs * ![](https://www.artisan.co/assets/blogs/list-item.svg) Chrome extension for prospecting while browsing ### Cons * ![](https://www.artisan.co/assets/blogs/list-item.svg) Expensive compared to other Apollo alternatives * ![](https://www.artisan.co/assets/blogs/list-item.svg) Small number of integrations compared to other tools * ![](https://www.artisan.co/assets/blogs/list-item.svg) Intent data is not available on all plans 10\. Pipedrive -------------- ![Pipedrive](https://www.artisan.co/_next/image?url=https%3A%2F%2Fimages.ctfassets.net%2Fkyprwggh4muz%2FQV7S0ivkXqIDivsNOTxxu%2F7bd736f3ccc4d68c9af281344e6c76ea%2FScreenshot__697_.png&w=3840&q=75) Pipedrive is a tool for running email campaigns and outreach workflows rather than for prospecting.  It’s an excellent enterprise-level sales enablement platform. But if you’re looking for fresh leads, you’ll need an additional service that provides access to a database.  ### Key features * ![](https://www.artisan.co/assets/blogs/list-item.svg) **Outreach management.** Manage leads and run segmented email campaigns. * ![](https://www.artisan.co/assets/blogs/list-item.svg) **Analytics.** Access granular data about your campaigns across a range of metrics like revenue targets and sales team performance.  * ![](https://www.artisan.co/assets/blogs/list-item.svg) **Large library of integrations.** Integrate Pipedrive with your whole tech stack.  ### Pricing Pipedrive offers several pricing plans, beginning at **$14/month per user** and ending at **$99/month** **per user**. All plans have free trials.  ### Pros * ![](https://www.artisan.co/assets/blogs/list-item.svg) Powerful enterprise-level sales enablement platform * ![](https://www.artisan.co/assets/blogs/list-item.svg) Growing AI functionality  * ![](https://www.artisan.co/assets/blogs/list-item.svg) Lots of integrations ### Cons * ![](https://www.artisan.co/assets/blogs/list-item.svg) It doesn’t provide access to a lead database * ![](https://www.artisan.co/assets/blogs/list-item.svg) Slightly convoluted pricing structure * ![](https://www.artisan.co/assets/blogs/list-item.svg) Intuitive and well-designed interface It’s time to say goodbye… ------------------------- We get it. Wading through sales enablement platforms is hard work. Learning to navigate different dashboards is time-consuming and frustrating. But it _is_ worth it.  ![Apollo Alternatives-2](https://www.artisan.co/_next/image?url=https%3A%2F%2Fimages.ctfassets.net%2Fkyprwggh4muz%2F1B94fTEXazeOSoGpC0lDu8%2Fa909b260d886e56d4442b5d72707ef6e%2F3.webp&w=3840&q=75) The hours you devote to picking the right tool—one that’s ideally suited to your and your team’s specific needs—is time well spent. Leads are the lifeblood of your business. And the tools you use will make a big difference.  As for parting advice, we recommend taking _full_ advantage of free trials and demos. Oh, and don’t forget to give Artisan a test drive. We know you’ll love it. Frequently Asked Questions (FAQs) --------------------------------- **What is Apollo.io?** Apollo is a lead prospecting and outreach platform. Its user base has grown substantially over the last several years and is now a market leader. Its top features include an extensive lead database and outreach automation tools.  **Why consider alternatives to Apollo.io?** Alternatives to Apollo may offer features better suited to your needs. Apollo’s competitors sometimes perform better in terms of database size, AI functionality, ease of use, and pricing, to name some examples.  **Which tool is best for small businesses?** Hunter, RocketReach, and Lusha all have pricing tiers that will appeal to small businesses. HubSpot Sales Hub is also a good option but doesn’t provide lead data.  **How to evaluate sales automation tools?** To evaluate sales automation tools, take full advantage of free trials, check the quality of the lead database by conducting your own searches, check user reviews, and don’t hesitate to contact support with questions.  Share Article ![copy-link](https://www.artisan.co/assets/blogs/copy-link.svg)[![copy-link](https://www.artisan.co/assets/blogs/mail.svg)](mailto:?body=https://www.artisan.co/blog/apollo-alternatives) You might also like ------------------- Ready to Supercharge Your Outbound? ----------------------------------- Our AI-first platform equips your team with best-in-class outbound tools and our AI BDR Ava, who automates your entire outbound workflow. [![artisan-logo](https://www.artisan.co/_next/image?url=%2Fassets%2Fartisan-primary-logo.webp&w=64&q=75)![artisan-logo](https://www.artisan.co/_next/image?url=%2Fassets%2Fartisan-text-logo.webp&w=256&q=75)](/) Products Solutions Resources [Pricing](/pricing) [Enterprise](/solutions/enterprise) [Login](https://app.artisan.co/login) Contact Sales Sales Top 10 Apollo Alternatives | Pricing, Features, Response Rates ============================================================== Updated On: July 23, 2024 14 minutes read ![copy-link](https://www.artisan.co/assets/blogs/copy-link.svg)[![copy-link](https://www.artisan.co/assets/blogs/mail.svg)](mailto:?body=https://www.artisan.co/blog/apollo-alternatives) ![Top 10 Apollo Alternatives | Pricing, Features, Response Rates](https://www.artisan.co/_next/image?url=https%3A%2F%2Fimages.ctfassets.net%2Fkyprwggh4muz%2FtThIzALNNJRnpvrieiRRn%2F35c233cd1d0dc246e45a000196ee1e86%2FArtboard_1.webp&w=3840&q=75) Apollo has rocketed in popularity over the last few years. Ranked among the market leaders in numerous categories on G2, there’s no doubt it’s a powerful platform.   But it’s not without its drawbacks.  Whatever your reasons for searching for an alternative, whether it’s Apollo’s price, complex dashboard and steep learning curve, lead data accuracy, or limited AI functionality, we’ve got your back.  We’ve covered the top alternatives to Apollo, from enterprise-level market leaders like ZoomInfo to fresh-off-the-line, AI-first companies like Artisan. And don’t worry, we’re not going to make it all about comparing the sizes of databases. We’re just going to make it a little bit about that.  Apollo Alternatives: Quick Comparison ------------------------------------- ![Apollo Comparison](https://www.artisan.co/_next/image?url=https%3A%2F%2Fimages.ctfassets.net%2Fkyprwggh4muz%2F5miaFBpW7PEgacNEtvtN5b%2F6d26a14879b3e71c798d80bbec4ef640%2F2.webp&w=3840&q=75) Here’s the ten-second breakdown of the top Apollo alternatives and what you can expect in terms of key features and pricing. We recommend reading the full article for a thorough understanding of your options, but this table will give you a solid overview of the market.  | | | | | | | --- | --- | --- | --- | --- | | **Company** | **Key Features** | **Pros** | **Cons** | **Pricing (Monthly)** | | Artisan | AI functionality
