How AI Is Changing Outbound Sales Automation in 2024
====================================================

Updated On: July 12, 2024

11 minutes read

![copy-link](https://www.artisan.co/assets/blogs/copy-link.svg)[![copy-link](https://www.artisan.co/assets/blogs/mail.svg)](mailto:?body=https://www.artisan.co/blog/outbound-sales-automation)

![How AI Is Changing Outbound Sales Automation in 2024](https://www.artisan.co/_next/image?url=https%3A%2F%2Fimages.ctfassets.net%2Fkyprwggh4muz%2F4DyuICDcaLAgUMhtHiUNsP%2F93a82e6644e54967dd8dac0ca7e9d588%2FArtboard_7.webp&w=3840&q=75)

Let’s be clear. If you’re doing outbound sales and still heavily relying on repetitive manual tasks, you’re doing something wrong. If you and your sales team are spending hours researching and writing individual emails to prospects, the ugly truth is that you’re quickly going to fall behind your competitors. It’s not that you’re doing anything wrong per se – it’s just that the numbers simply can’t compare.

  

[According to Operatix](https://www.operatix.net/blogs/sdr-metrics-outbound-inbound-teams/)
, an outbound SDR books an average of fifteen meetings a month, of which only twelve will actually be completed. That might not seem too bad on its own, but when you consider that most outbound engines consist of tens of SDRs, all being paid handsomely for performing repetitive tasks by hand, it starts to sound majorly suspect.

  
![Outbound SDR Chart](https://www.artisan.co/_next/image?url=https%3A%2F%2Fimages.ctfassets.net%2Fkyprwggh4muz%2F4Zpb4z7kKt6yR9vFf7dHae%2F037554f33d2ccbb68be0e416890a00fe%2FScreenshot_2024-06-28_at_4.15.04_PM.png&w=3840&q=75)

  
_From Operatix's SDR Metrics Report_

  

So it should probably come as no surprise that implementing outbound sales automation tools produces compelling results indeed. [Hubspot’s research](https://blog.hubspot.com/sales/sales-automation-stats)
 shows companies that invest in AI and automation software report a 10-20% boost in sales ROI; of the top sellers, 80% use these tools on a regular basis. 

  

These companies aren’t just saving time (though [49% of them](https://www.kixie.com/sales-blog/27-sales-automation-statistics-you-need-to-know-in-2023/)
 say that’s the single biggest benefit). They’re also improving communication and allocating more of their most precious resource – the energy of their employees – towards higher-quality, more challenging tasks. 

  

Outbound sales automation isn’t going anywhere, clearly. So it’s probably best if you understand it as deeply as possible. Let’s take a closer look.

  

Key Components of Outbound Sales Automation
-------------------------------------------

![social media post scraping](https://www.artisan.co/_next/image?url=https%3A%2F%2Fimages.ctfassets.net%2Fkyprwggh4muz%2F3WHk3zkXgczmT0rvbVXjdm%2Fc19fa2be883dd6b0ed2cd6e504e7d7ff%2F1__Social_Media_Post_Scrapping.webp&w=3840&q=75)

### Lead Generation and Scoring

Widely considered every rep’s least favorite job, lead generation and qualification is the bedrock of every successful pipeline. But it’s repetitive, it’s boring, and it’s dangerously prone to human error – just try sending an email to a mistyped address and see how far it gets you.

  

All of these factors make it the ideal task to be automated. By setting out predefined criteria, outbound sales automation programs can gather, organize, and score leads at a scale that humans simply can’t compete with. 

  

### Drafting and Sending Personalized Email Sequences and Follow-Up Messages

Before too long, we’re going to have to retire the phrase “the human touch”, because recent advances in AI have made those lines a whole lot blurrier than they used to be. Using a range of high-tech features, automated sales software is more than capable of developing personalized cold emails and follow-up communications based on customer behavior and preferences. Social media post scraping, for example, makes it possible to get instant insight into a prospect’s mindset and gather intent data at scale, while technographic data can be gathered to see what tech stack they’re currently using. 

  

And thanks to the increasingly multi-modal nature of these programs, it’s possible to automate the task of following up across several different channels. It’s not just email: social media platforms, text messages and even phone calls can all join the party, saving even more time for sales reps and radically increasing workflow efficiency.

  

### Automate Repetitive Administrative Tasks

Data entry. Meeting scheduling. Updating CRM records. To know them is to loathe them, but these dull admin jobs are an essential element in any successful sales engine. Thankfully, we might not need to dread doing them ourselves for much longer.

  

Due to its repetitive nature, this kind of busywork is a prime candidate for automation. There’s little to no independent reasoning required. In most cases, it’s a tick-box exercise where the only criterion for success is not getting anything wrong. And even the best sales professionals make mistakes, especially when they’ve been doing the same task for hours – but machines don’t.

  

Optimizing the Sales Process
----------------------------

![Email Campaigns](https://www.artisan.co/_next/image?url=https%3A%2F%2Fimages.ctfassets.net%2Fkyprwggh4muz%2F2710IAedPcYEoh4qe7e5Mn%2F4354a2bc9a080b4cb2fbe659f1a584ea%2F3__Email_Campaigns.webp&w=3840&q=75)

### Workflow Automation

When it comes to optimizing a sales process, there’s no better place to start than at the workflow level. There are a number of different ways automation can be employed, but the most common include automating repetitive tasks (like the ones mentioned above) and designing more efficient, AI-friendly workflows from the ground up. 

  

For example, if a company knows it’s going to be using outbound sales automation software, there’s no reason to train its reps on tasks like data entry or CRM updates. Instead, the workflow could be crafted to work with the AI – effectively using the result of its busywork, double-checking for errors, tweaking personalized cold emails, and so on.

  

**Are you ready to try sales automation on the cutting edge?** [Check out how Ava can automate 80% of your outbound cycle.](https://www.artisan.co/ai-sales-agent)
 She frees up your sales team’s time to focus on the most important thing – closing deals!

  

### Lead Generation and Management

Outbound sales automation software can – and will – revolutionize the way you think about lead generation and lead management. Forget about painstakingly scouring LinkedIn, Google, and other sources to compile a list of prospects. Just set the program up with your ideal customer profile (ICP) and let it do the heavy lifting for you.

  

But the magic doesn’t stop there. High-end automation software will also pre-qualify the prospects on your lead lists by bounce-testing leads, assessing them against your ideal ICP, and ranking them by priority. As a result, by the time your reps start interacting with them, they already know where to focus most of their time and energy. And with automated enrichment, by the time salespeople interact with the potential customers in their sales pipeline, they’ll already have a wealth of data to draw on.

  

### Email Campaigns and Sequences

Here’s a statistic so ridiculous that it sounds made-up at first. [According to research](https://www.rpeorigin.com/2023/09/2023-new-research-on-enterprise-use-of-ai-in-email/)
 carried out by Ascend2 RPE Origina, running A/B tests on your emails can increase ROI by 82%, from 23:1 all the way to 42:1. A/B testing is just one of several weapons in any outbound sales team’s arsenal – and sales automation software is capable of performing those analyses all on its own.

  

A/B testing isn’t the only way email automation can enhance marketing efforts, though. It can set up, run, and optimize entire outreach campaigns. By drawing on a wealth of customer preference data, sales automation programs can personalize every aspect of the email outreach process. Automated email playbooks can be generated based on what content those customers are most likely to respond to, for example, while real-time email sequences make it possible to interact with each ideal customer at the perfect moment based on past behavior.

  

Enhancing Sales Team Productivity
---------------------------------

![AI Powered Automation](https://www.artisan.co/_next/image?url=https%3A%2F%2Fimages.ctfassets.net%2Fkyprwggh4muz%2F3idsNDo74v1GtZwxaDTGPu%2F9e1ca1e02bb63913ce481caff59ee990%2F4__AI_Powered_Automation.webp&w=3840&q=75)

### Roles of Sales Reps and SDRs

So far, we’ve focused on the technical nitty-gritty behind what automation software is actually _doing_. But we haven’t discussed the elephant in the room yet. What happens to the reps and SDRs who all of a sudden find they’ve got nothing left to do because it’s all been automated?

  

Well, that’s not quite the case. Sure, sales team members won’t be as busy with time-consuming, manual tasks like lead scoring or churning out follow-up emails. Instead, they’ll be devoting their energy towards high-value sales engagement activities that only they can perform.

  

The actual art of selling – the cold calling, the back-and-forth, the push-and-pull, the cat and the proverbial mouse – is all still firmly the domain of humans. And because they don’t need to waste time on manual busywork, reps and SDRs will be able to hyper-focus their sales efforts on the tasks that ultimately bring in revenue for their organization. 

  

There’s still a place for traditional sales reps, sales managers, and SDRs. But their role is going to look drastically different from how it used to – more productive, more challenging, and ultimately more rewarding.  
  
And for companies, the potential for improvement is just as significant. Every manager has wished they could make a dozen copies of their best-performing rep and populate the entire team with them. Well, that’s pretty much possible now, with the ability to replicate the strategies of top-performing salespeople, streamline them, and circulate them across the entire team. By making the most of an automation platform, every BDR can be turned into a top-performing sales rep, radically increasing productivity and efficiency across the board.

  

### Sales Engagement Strategies

According to a [2023 study](https://belkins.io/blog/cold-email-response-rates#:~:text=The%20average%20cold%20email%20response,from%206.1%25%20to%202.5%25.)
 carried out by Belkins, cold email reply rates range from as low as 2% in some major industries to as high as 10% in others. Which is less than ideal, given that the ROI for emails can be as [high as 45x](https://www.litmus.com/blog/infographic-the-roi-of-email-marketing)
. So increasing response rates should obviously be a matter of high priority for any team looking to optimize its sales funnel, schedule more meetings and fill up its pipeline with high-quality potential deals.

  
![ROI by Industry](https://www.artisan.co/_next/image?url=https%3A%2F%2Fimages.ctfassets.net%2Fkyprwggh4muz%2F57P65iiK4Iya3W5a1EL3Cc%2F6500c670082c618fb9219cd78e2c5a20%2FScreenshot_2024-06-28_at_4.26.50_PM.png&w=3840&q=75)

_From Litmus' ROI of Email Marketing Infographic_

  

Fortunately, automation can help out here as well. Machine-learning powered outbound sales technology makes personalized outreach possible at a scale humans simply can’t compete with, allowing forward-thinking sales teams to ramp up their volume without needing to sacrifice the individual touch that can often make all the difference.

  

In a similar vein, consistency, frequency and optimal timing are all elements of the outreach process that can be automated with ease. The potential for ultra-precise segmentation gives every single email the best chance of reaching its ideal customer, while detailed analytics and comprehensive A/B testing functionality makes it possible to improve the overall process in real-time.

  

Leveraging Technology for Sales Success
---------------------------------------

![Lead Generation + Management](https://www.artisan.co/_next/image?url=https%3A%2F%2Fimages.ctfassets.net%2Fkyprwggh4muz%2F3h1R5TefyohGqDH3Zha6bg%2Fed3ba44a36a22248a6a4c9cfbf4404fc%2F2__Lead_Generation___Managemetn.webp&w=3840&q=75)

### AI-Powered Automation

We’ve already discussed how that outbound sales automation technology is capable of personalizing sales outreach communication at scale. But we haven’t actually discussed what that looks like in practice – and what better real-world example than Artisan’s very own [AI BDR, Ava](https://www.artisan.co/ai-sales-agent)
?

  

Ava’s capable of scraping prospects’ social media posts in order to update her customer profiles with the most recent personal data. For instance, imagine you’re a B2B SaaS company selling HR payroll software. Your ideal customers, in this example, are startups that have just raised funding. Ava, thanks to her Crunchbase integration, will automatically be able to identify startups that have recently raised rounds, enroll them in a workflow, and be the first one in their email inbox with a hyper-personalized message.

  

Now picture that same process happening constantly, across every single prospect you’re working with, without your reps needing to lift a finger. If that’s not a game-changer, we don’t know what is.

  

The real beauty of AI-powered automation lies in its ability to continuously learn and improve. Predictive analytics, powered by the constant stream of data the software is taking in, makes it possible to discover trends, make informed predictions about future performance and tweak your current strategy for the highest probability of success. And because it’s all powered by AI, the entire process can happen at as large a scale as you need it to.

  

### Integrations and Functionalities

The modern business world is hyper-connected, so it only stands to reason that sales software should be as well. And as any SDR will be able to tell you, the sheer amount of business tools available these days is nothing short of staggering. Email marketing software, CRMs, data integration suites, analytics programs – the list goes on.

  

With such a smorgasbord of tools being used on a daily basis, it’s vitally important that outbound sales automation software can integrate with all of them. Switching seamlessly from prospecting software to updating your CRM of choice, drawing on analytics reports to inform cold email outreach: it all works together, and it all _just works_.

  

But none of that means you should need to completely redesign your existing strategies in order to implement automation technology. The best software will automatically hook into your existing CRM, automatically trawling through your existing insights and re-engaging qualified leads that have gone cold. Next, it’ll update your CRM with ultra-precise, bang up-to-date details like method of engagement, behavior data points, additional insights, and so on.  
  
All of this helps optimize your process and increase your results, and it all happens on auto-pilot, freeing up dozens of hours of manual work that can be redirected towards actively selling instead.

  

**Ready to step into the future of outbound?** [Check out how Ava automates 80% of your outbound cycle.](https://www.artisan.co/ai-sales-agent)

  

Measuring and Improving Sales Performance
-----------------------------------------

![Analytics](https://www.artisan.co/_next/image?url=https%3A%2F%2Fimages.ctfassets.net%2Fkyprwggh4muz%2F4FEAIRfS7VQpzHLNFAF15m%2Ff5124fa67eb742adb75a5f4f1140c2db%2FScreenshot_2024-06-28_at_5.19.47_PM.png&w=3840&q=75)

### Key Metrics and KPIs

One of the biggest advantages provided by sales automation tools is their ability to process huge amounts of data.

  

*   ![](https://www.artisan.co/assets/blogs/list-item.svg)
    
    **Conversion Rates.** By analyzing conversion rates at scale across your entire funnel, automation can help identify speed bumps and suggest strategies for fixing the problem, saving you dozens of hours of manual analysis in the process.
    
      
    
*   ![](https://www.artisan.co/assets/blogs/list-item.svg)
    
    **Sales Cycle Time.** Automation can spot the points in the sales cycle that accelerate it the most and help you prioritize them in your process. 
    
      
    
*   ![](https://www.artisan.co/assets/blogs/list-item.svg)
    
    **Lead-to-Close Ratios.** When you use automation to analyze your lead-to-close ratios, you get far deeper insights into areas for optimization thanks to the sheer depth and breadth of the data being mined.
    
      
    

### Continuous Optimization

Not unlike those sharks who never stop moving, if a sales team stops optimizing its process, it’ll fall behind its competitors. Thankfully, outbound sales automation software allows you to improve as you go across the board.  
  
With automation, software will be able to automatically set different campaigns, run tests, and implement improvements based on KPIs and ideal results. We’re essentially entering a new paradigm of continuous and automatic optimization, where sales reps don’t have to manually set and adjust campaigns anymore, and where every major decision throughout the outbound sales process is made based on huge treasure troves of cold, hard data.

  

A Look Ahead to Emerging Tools and Technologies
-----------------------------------------------

![Ava ](https://www.artisan.co/_next/image?url=https%3A%2F%2Fimages.ctfassets.net%2Fkyprwggh4muz%2F1F1K07Hn1H4RBzoqR7Rips%2F290b810b3dfd3f3c30c2529376c62765%2F5__ending.webp&w=3840&q=75)

### AI and Machine Learning

AI and Machine Learning is poised to radically disrupt the current sales landscape – the advantages offered by automation are just too much of a game-changer to ignore. For example, take [Ava, Artisan’s AI BDR](https://www.artisan.co/ai-sales-agent)
. She’ll be able to automate 80% of a human BDR’s workflow, make her own autonomous decisions, brief you on upcoming meetings, reach out to new prospects, and keep everything meticulously updated in her CRM. By using cutting-edge technology to analyze, implement, and continuously optimize at scale, forward-looking organizations will find themselves at a distinct advantage over any of their competitors who haven’t yet integrated automation into their processes.

  

### Enhanced CRM Capabilities

As AI continues to improve day-by-day, CRMs are becoming more powerful than ever. Some of the most exciting features include natural language processing, sentiment analysis, real-time decision-making, and even truly sci-fi concepts like recognizing faces or voices via biometric analysis. For a sales rep using the CRM of tomorrow, the workflow is going to be almost unrecognizable. Instead of manually entering lead data and moving the process along by hand, they might simply talk to their software instead, asking for specific insights, the latest updates on their deals, or guidance as to what they should focus on next.  
  
The CRM will be able to suggest the best way for the rep to spend their time based on the current state of the pipeline. Maybe it’s the perfect moment to reach out to that prospect from a couple weeks ago, because sentiment analysis of a recent Tweet has revealed they’re particularly unhappy with their current solution. Or maybe it’s time to strike while the iron is hot on a few new leads, because past insights on leads in a similar industry indicates they respond best to a quick invitation to a product demo. 

  

The possibilities are endless; the potential, staggering. To sum it all up in plain English, it’s an exciting time to be in sales – and the future’s only getting brighter.

  

**Experience cutting-edge sales automation firsthand.** [Hire Ava](https://www.artisan.co/ai-sales-agent)
 and she’ll immediately launch a lead generation campaign just for you, focusing all her efforts on high-quality leads and quick results.

AI Language Models: The Case for Cultivating Context
====================================================

Updated On: June 20, 2024

6 min read

![copy-link](https://www.artisan.co/assets/blogs/copy-link.svg)[![copy-link](https://www.artisan.co/assets/blogs/mail.svg)](mailto:?body=https://www.artisan.co/blog/ai-language-models-2024)

![AI Language Models: The Case for Cultivating Context](https://www.artisan.co/_next/image?url=https%3A%2F%2Fimages.ctfassets.net%2Fkyprwggh4muz%2F2iiVSeM6X0uLCUPXbD6LXY%2Fb410dd123456a7fbab1309438a727b70%2FArtboard_3.webp&w=3840&q=75)

Human beings’ unique relationship with language makes training AI language models an uphill battle. Language separates us from our primate cousins. As noted by Mark Pagel in a recent [BMC Biology paper](https://bmcbiol.biomedcentral.com/articles/10.1186/s12915-017-0405-3#citeas)
, “It is unlikely that any other species, including our close genetic cousins the Neanderthals, ever had language.” However, language alone isn’t our only differentiator as a species. Humans also possess the “[urge to connect](https://www.scientificamerican.com/article/2-mental-abilities-separate-humans-from-animals/)
.” That is, the drive to exchange thoughts and ideas with others.

  

These two traits have created language that is both versatile and valuable, but eternally vexing to engineers and developers looking to bridge the gap between technology and the human condition.

  

Artificial intelligence (AI) is one recent effort to imbue programs with human-like qualities. It’s a long road to artificial general intelligence, or general AI, which could mimic humans’ general cognitive abilities. However, we are making inroads with specific AI use cases that could change how we interact with the world and with each other.

  

AI language models, also called large language models (LLMs) are one area of AI undergoing rapid evolution. In this piece, we’ll explore the unique properties of human language, the barriers to effective AI understanding, and how evolving LLMs may pave the way for a new kind of conversation.

  

**AI Language Models: From Primates to Programs**
-------------------------------------------------

Studies have shown that primates can recognize and respond to specific language cues — one gorilla even had a “vocabulary” of [over 2,000 words](https://www.nationalgeographic.com/animals/article/gorillas-koko-sign-language-culture-animals)
! Programs are also capable of parsing language. For example, first-generation chatbots could pick out key words and phrases to help users find specific content or refer them to support.

  

Humans, however, go beyond these basics thanks to a key concept: context.

  

Consider a conversation between two friends. The first asks how the second is doing, and the second replies “fine”. The word is easy to parse: [Merriam-Webster](https://www.merriam-webster.com/dictionary/fine)
 defines it as “well or healthy; not sick or injured.” Despite the obvious meaning, however, the first friend replies “I’m here if you need to talk.”

  

What happened? Put simply, the first friend both heard the word and saw the connecting context. Common contextual considerations include tone of voice, facial expressions, volume, and body language. By aggregating this data, humans are capable of understanding both the surface and subtextual meanings of language. This isn’t to say we’re perfect — our lives are full of misread situations and misunderstandings because context wasn’t clear. However, while it may not always be 100% accurate, the ability to capture context is why even the smartest primates can’t quite reach human intelligence levels.

  

It is also why language analysis technologies have historically struggled to move beyond basic questions-and-answers. However, AI language models have made remarkable advances in recent years.

  

**Can AI Language Models Break Barriers?**
------------------------------------------

Along with context, human language is also unique because it’s compositional. This property allows humans to express their thoughts in sentences that recognize multiple tenses and use a combination of subjects, objects, and verbs. With just 25 subjects, 25 objects, and 25 verbs, it’s possible to create [more than 15,000 sentences](https://bmcbiol.biomedcentral.com/articles/10.1186/s12915-017-0405-3#)
.

  

The compositional nature of human language also makes it possible to create strings of seemingly nonsense words that actually make sense in context. Consider the (in)famous buffalo sentence below:

  

_Buffalo buffalo Buffalo buffalo buffalo buffalo Buffalo buffalo._

  

While this looks like gibberish, it’s grammatically correct. It lacks punctuation and articles such as “which” or “that”, but it is possible to understand. Here’s how.

  

The three blue Buffalos represent the city of Buffalo.

  

The three pink buffalo refer to groups of the animal, while the two green buffalo represent the verb buffalo, which means to intimidate or confuse. Putting that all together, the meaning of the sentence becomes:

  

_A group of buffalo, from Buffalo, that are intimidated by a group of buffalo from Buffalo, also intimate a group of buffalo from Buffalo._

  

Sure, it’s not an easy read, but with the ability to parse compositional language, it does make sense. While most human sentences aren’t quite so convoluted, we naturally assume that listeners have the ability to combine the obvious meaning of our words with both contextual and compositional clues.

  

The result is what we’ve seen for years around the development of AI language models: they do well when sentences are simple and straightforward, but struggle when meanings aren’t clear.

  

Emerging AI language models, however, are changing the game.

  

### The Basics of LLMs

AI language models aren’t new. As artificial intelligence moved from potential to possible, researchers quickly realized the potential of AI to analyze and understand language. Historically, however, language models were limited in scope and size.

  

In addition, these models assigned equal weight to each word in a sentence, meaning they weren’t able to parse any meaning beyond the obvious. This made them ideal for simple, self-service tasks. Take first-generation chatbots. They could point users in the direction of specific resources or connect them to customer service agents, but lacked the ability to dive any deeper.

  

What’s the difference between AI language models and chatbots? The former are far more advanced.

  

Large language models change the game. These models utilize deep learning architectures called transformer networks and models. Models are neural networks that learn how to read context and meaning in sequential data, including data found in human language.

  

Unlike their smaller-scale progenitors, large-scale models have access to much larger datasets. These datasets allow LLMs to provide more accurate and more contextually-relevant answers thanks to two key transformer network innovations: positional encoding and self-attention.

  

Positional encoding makes it possible for language models to analyze input data in any order, rather than relying on the sequential input of words. Self-attention, meanwhile, makes it possible for models to assign different weights to different parts of a sentence based on both the current data input and the analysis of all previous language inputs.

  

Together, positional encoding and self-attention make it possible for LLMs to quickly process large volumes of data and produce more accurate query results.

  

### Artificial Intelligence, Real Impact: Large Language Models in Action

It’s one thing to design a language model capable of improving over time to better understand humans and provide relevant responses, but what does this look like in practice?

  

Here are five examples of language learning models in action.

  

#### Search Results

Search engines such as Google and Bing are already using LLMs to improve search results. By applying large language models to understand the context of user queries, search engines can provide more accurate, relevant hits.

  

#### Content Generation

Tools like ChatGPT and Dall-E are now using AI language models to generate new content based on user criteria. For example, staff might ask ChatGPT to provide subject lines for marketing emails, or offer ideas for a new blog post. Dall-E, meanwhile, can create AI-generated art in the style of one (or many) historic artists.

  

#### Customer Service

From a customer service standpoint, chatbots are the most common application of large language models. With access to large enough datasets — both internally and externally — chatbots and digital workers are now capable of understanding user intention and basic emotion to provide improved customer service.

  

Consider a frustrated customer connected with a service chatbot. Based on the type of language used and the way sentences are constructed, the chatbot can recognize the need for speedy resolution and connect the customer with the ideal service agent. [Artisan AI Sales Reps](/ai-sales-agent)
 go even deeper. These digital employees act very much like a human worker and can respond to user inquiries, communicate with your team, and much more.

  

#### Language Translation

LLMs are also being used in language translation. Given their ability to pull meaning and context from user-generated input, AI-driven models are ideally suited to ensuring translations aren’t simply direct transformations of words and phrases. Instead, LLMs accurately identify and carry over the subtleties and meaning from input language to output content.

  

#### Document Analysis

For industries such as finance, law, and healthcare, LLMs can be used to identify key themes, pinpoint repeated themes or ideas, or discover issues with reporting and documentation that must be addressed before reports are filed or businesses take action.

  

**What’s Next?**
----------------

The nature of AI language models means they’re always improving. More data means more context, and a greater ability to deliver accurate results.

  

But what comes next? As noted by [Forbes](https://www.forbes.com/sites/robtoews/2023/02/07/the-next-generation-of-large-language-models/?sh=16623cef18db)
, one significant change already underway is the explosive growth of generative AI tools, such as ChatGPT. This natural language processing tool (NLP) makes it possible for humans to have human-like conversations with AI. Initially, these tools learned using collected data from all previous queries. Newer versions of ChatGPT are capable of searching the Internet at large for data to create effective replies.

  

Despite advancements, however, AI tools are not yet perfect. While they can produce human-like responses, these responses may not be accurate. This is because they’re designed to generate answers that are plausible and easy to parse — but aren’t necessarily factual. This creates another opportunity for AI growth: knowledge retrieval. Here, LLMs are provided with access to external knowledge sources and use these sources to ensure answers are factual and accurate in addition to being easy on the eyes.

  

There’s also a growing demand for digital workers capable of automating tasks in a specific role. For example, digital workers might act as sales representatives, marketers, designers, or recruiters. Using advanced AI, these workers are capable of carrying out all the tasks associated with their role, and can also interact directly with human workers. In effect, they act as full-fledged members of business teams, albeit with lower costs and improved performance.

  

This includes [Artisan AI’s sales rep, Ava](/ai-sales-agent)
. Ava is a fully automated outbound sales rep capable of doing everything from booking meetings to sending emails to responding to customer inquiries. Also, much like a real worker, Ava learns over time. Her built-in cutting-edge analytics help her self-improve and optimize her performance.

  

It’s also worth noting that as AI language models evolve, so too will the role of human workers. While there’s a growing fear of AI replacing human staff, the far more likely scenario is that roles will simply shift. While AI might handle the heavy lifting of drafting a marketing email or creating a web design, humans in the loop remain essential to review and revise ideas before they go live.

  

**The Bottom Line: AI Language Models and Language 2.0**
--------------------------------------------------------

While AI will never be quite “human”, it’s inching closer and closer to the mark. AI language models are a key step in this progression — the ability to understand content and context and improve this understanding over time sets the stage for new iterations of AI capable of answering more questions, delivering more accurate results, and streamlining key business processes.

====================================================

Updated On: June 20, 2024

6 min read

![copy-link](https://www.artisan.co/assets/blogs/copy-link.svg)[![copy-link](https://www.artisan.co/assets/blogs/mail.svg)](mailto:?body=https://www.artisan.co/blog/ai-language-models-2024)

![AI Language Models: The Case for Cultivating Context](https://www.artisan.co/_next/image?url=https%3A%2F%2Fimages.ctfassets.net%2Fkyprwggh4muz%2F2iiVSeM6X0uLCUPXbD6LXY%2Fb410dd123456a7fbab1309438a727b70%2FArtboard_3.webp&w=3840&q=75)

Human beings’ unique relationship with language makes training AI language models an uphill battle. Language separates us from our primate cousins. As noted by Mark Pagel in a recent [BMC Biology paper](https://bmcbiol.biomedcentral.com/articles/10.1186/s12915-017-0405-3#citeas)
, “It is unlikely that any other species, including our close genetic cousins the Neanderthals, ever had language.” However, language alone isn’t our only differentiator as a species. Humans also possess the “[urge to connect](https://www.scientificamerican.com/article/2-mental-abilities-separate-humans-from-animals/)
.” That is, the drive to exchange thoughts and ideas with others.

  

These two traits have created language that is both versatile and valuable, but eternally vexing to engineers and developers looking to bridge the gap between technology and the human condition.

  

Artificial intelligence (AI) is one recent effort to imbue programs with human-like qualities. It’s a long road to artificial general intelligence, or general AI, which could mimic humans’ general cognitive abilities. However, we are making inroads with specific AI use cases that could change how we interact with the world and with each other.

  

AI language models, also called large language models (LLMs) are one area of AI undergoing rapid evolution. In this piece, we’ll explore the unique properties of human language, the barriers to effective AI understanding, and how evolving LLMs may pave the way for a new kind of conversation.

  

**AI Language Models: From Primates to Programs**
-------------------------------------------------

Studies have shown that primates can recognize and respond to specific language cues — one gorilla even had a “vocabulary” of [over 2,000 words](https://www.nationalgeographic.com/animals/article/gorillas-koko-sign-language-culture-animals)
! Programs are also capable of parsing language. For example, first-generation chatbots could pick out key words and phrases to help users find specific content or refer them to support.

  

Humans, however, go beyond these basics thanks to a key concept: context.

  

Consider a conversation between two friends. The first asks how the second is doing, and the second replies “fine”. The word is easy to parse: [Merriam-Webster](https://www.merriam-webster.com/dictionary/fine)
 defines it as “well or healthy; not sick or injured.” Despite the obvious meaning, however, the first friend replies “I’m here if you need to talk.”

  

What happened? Put simply, the first friend both heard the word and saw the connecting context. Common contextual considerations include tone of voice, facial expressions, volume, and body language. By aggregating this data, humans are capable of understanding both the surface and subtextual meanings of language. This isn’t to say we’re perfect — our lives are full of misread situations and misunderstandings because context wasn’t clear. However, while it may not always be 100% accurate, the ability to capture context is why even the smartest primates can’t quite reach human intelligence levels.

  

It is also why language analysis technologies have historically struggled to move beyond basic questions-and-answers. However, AI language models have made remarkable advances in recent years.

  

**Can AI Language Models Break Barriers?**
------------------------------------------

Along with context, human language is also unique because it’s compositional. This property allows humans to express their thoughts in sentences that recognize multiple tenses and use a combination of subjects, objects, and verbs. With just 25 subjects, 25 objects, and 25 verbs, it’s possible to create [more than 15,000 sentences](https://bmcbiol.biomedcentral.com/articles/10.1186/s12915-017-0405-3#)
.

  

The compositional nature of human language also makes it possible to create strings of seemingly nonsense words that actually make sense in context. Consider the (in)famous buffalo sentence below:

  

_Buffalo buffalo Buffalo buffalo buffalo buffalo Buffalo buffalo._

  

While this looks like gibberish, it’s grammatically correct. It lacks punctuation and articles such as “which” or “that”, but it is possible to understand. Here’s how.

  

The three blue Buffalos represent the city of Buffalo.

  

The three pink buffalo refer to groups of the animal, while the two green buffalo represent the verb buffalo, which means to intimidate or confuse. Putting that all together, the meaning of the sentence becomes:

  

_A group of buffalo, from Buffalo, that are intimidated by a group of buffalo from Buffalo, also intimate a group of buffalo from Buffalo._

  

Sure, it’s not an easy read, but with the ability to parse compositional language, it does make sense. While most human sentences aren’t quite so convoluted, we naturally assume that listeners have the ability to combine the obvious meaning of our words with both contextual and compositional clues.

  

The result is what we’ve seen for years around the development of AI language models: they do well when sentences are simple and straightforward, but struggle when meanings aren’t clear.

  

Emerging AI language models, however, are changing the game.

 go even deeper. These digital employees act very much like a human worker and can respond to user inquiries, communicate with your team, and much more.

LLMs are also being used in language translation. Instead, LLMs accurately identify and carry over the subtleties and meaning from input language to output content.

For industries such as finance, law, and healthcare, LLMs can be used to identify key themes, pinpoint repeated themes or ideas, or discover issues with reporting and documentation that must be addressed before reports are filed or businesses take action.

----------------

But what comes next? As noted by [Forbes](https://www.forbes.com/sites/robtoews/2023/02/07/the-next-generation-of-large-language-models/?sh=16623cef18db)
, one significant change already underway is the explosive growth of generative AI tools, such as ChatGPT. This natural language processing tool (NLP) makes it possible for humans to have human-like conversations with AI. Initially, these tools learned using collected data from all previous queries. Newer versions of ChatGPT are capable of searching the Internet at large for data to create effective replies.

  

Despite advancements, however, AI tools are not yet perfect. While they can produce human-like responses, these responses may not be accurate. This is because they’re designed to generate answers that are plausible and easy to parse — but aren’t necessarily factual. This creates another opportunity for AI growth: knowledge retrieval. Here, LLMs are provided with access to external knowledge sources and use these sources to ensure answers are factual and accurate in addition to being easy on the eyes.

Using advanced AI, these workers are capable of carrying out all the tasks associated with their role, and can also interact directly with human workers. In effect, they act as full-fledged members of business teams, albeit with lower costs and improved performance.

. Ava is a fully automated outbound sales rep capable of doing everything from booking meetings to sending emails to responding to customer inquiries. Also, much like a real worker, Ava learns over time. Her built-in cutting-edge analytics help her self-improve and optimize her performance.

While there’s a growing fear of AI replacing human staff, the far more likely scenario is that roles will simply shift. While AI might handle the heavy lifting of drafting a marketing email or creating a web design, humans in the loop remain essential to review and revise ideas before they go live.

The Ultimate Outbound Sales Playbook: How to Master Proactive Prospecting
=========================================================================

Updated On: June 20, 2024

12 min read

![copy-link](https://www.artisan.co/assets/blogs/copy-link.svg)[![copy-link](https://www.artisan.co/assets/blogs/mail.svg)](mailto:?body=https://www.artisan.co/blog/the-ultimate-outbound-sales-playbook-how-to-master-proactive-prospecting)

![The Ultimate Outbound Sales Playbook: How to Master Proactive Prospecting](https://www.artisan.co/_next/image?url=https%3A%2F%2Fimages.ctfassets.net%2Fkyprwggh4muz%2F3ElxA0HQJK0uwlgRf1sMLG%2Ff24ffc463d4755d2937c627a3cc030ae%2FArtboard_15.webp&w=3840&q=75)

The outbound sales landscape has changed a lot in recent years. With content marketing, social media marketing, blogging, and video dominating, you might think old-school outbound techniques are obsolete by now.

  

But don’t be fooled – outbound is still going strong.

  

In fact, [75% of executives](https://spotio.com/blog/sales-statistics/#outboundsales)
 state that they’d be willing to make an appointment or attend an event based on a single cold call or email, showcasing just how effective outbound can be.

  

_If conducted properly,_ that is.

  

But enough about other companies – let’s talk about your business. How are your outbound efforts stacking up? Are you seeing the results you want? If not, you’ve come to the right place for a tune-up.

  

Today, we’ll explore how outbound creates opportunities instead of just waiting for inbound leads. I’ll share not only how to make outbound work for you but how to master the entire process from A to Z.

  

So, buckle up and get ready to become an outbound sales pro. With the right strategy and execution, you can transform outbound from outdated to cutting-edge. Let’s stop wondering and start dominating!

  

**An Introduction to Outbound Sales**
-------------------------------------

![21](https://www.artisan.co/_next/image?url=https%3A%2F%2Fimages.ctfassets.net%2Fkyprwggh4muz%2F4YUhg6rjsxZgr6LQxqCtyZ%2F8f8a6dfb707521da91b6aa3a39be877a%2F21.jpeg&w=3840&q=75)

Outbound sales are the opposite of the “build it, and they will come” mindset.

  

Instead, you’re putting on those walking shoes, grabbing your Rolodex, and hitting the pavement to hunt down leads that are best suited for your business.

  

While both inbound and outbound sales aim to bring in customers and make sales, outbound sales offer a unique advantage compared with the inbound process.

  

One word: **control**.

  

With outbound sales, you steer the ship and chart your own course. Instead of passively relying on leads finding you, you actively seek them out on your terms. And the more time and resources you dedicate, the more prospects you’ll uncover.

  

What’s more, outbound gives you total control to build your pipeline precisely how you want, focusing on the targets and leads you to deem most promising.

  

No more waiting and hoping – just good old-fashioned hustle.

  

These are just a handful of the many advantages outbound sales offers. If you want to grab the reins and take charge of your pipeline, outbound is the way to go!

  

### **What’s the Difference Between Outbound and Inbound Sales?**

With inbound sales, you take a more passive approach. Like casting a wide net and seeing what fish swim into it, you create content, optimize for search, and run campaigns hoping to attract leads.

  

If someone reaches out (or you hook them) after seeing your stuff, that’s inbound working its magic!

  

Outbound sales are the opposite – think door-to-door salesperson vs. bait shop owner.

  

Instead of waiting around, you grab your tackle box and actively head out into the world to hunt for leads. This requires research to find potential customers, crafting personalized messages, and reaching out through email, social media, calls, etc.

  

While inbound and outbound sales effectively have a similar goal, inbound marketing is sitting back with a Mai Tai, hoping the fish bite. Outbound is putting on waders, grabbing a net, and scooping up fish whether they’re biting or not.

  

Remember, there is no inbound vs outbound sales war. Both are valid strategies with pros and cons! One is reactive, one proactive. Choose the approach that fits your sales style and business goals.

  

### **The Problem With Modern Outbound Sales**

Let’s address the elephant in the room – many businesses are struggling with outbound sales.

  

According to [a 2022 Hubspot report](https://www.hubspot.com/marketing-statistics?)
, only 16% of marketers say outbound practices lead to quality leads. Ineffective outbound sales strategies prove this, with [over half of outbound marketers](https://www.zendesk.co.uk/blog/sales-statistics/)
 admitting their approaches just aren’t working.

  

There are plenty of fingers pointing at issues like:

  

*   ![](https://www.artisan.co/assets/blogs/list-item.svg)
    
    Poor communication between teams
    
      
    
*   ![](https://www.artisan.co/assets/blogs/list-item.svg)
    
    Not having enough info to properly engage prospects
    
      
    
*   ![](https://www.artisan.co/assets/blogs/list-item.svg)
    
    Skyrocketing customer expectations
    
      
    

  
The bottom line? Despite time and money invested in outbound, results are stagnant, draining, and unproductive.

  

However, the problem is not that outbound sales are inherently bad practice so much as a lack of clear strategy.

  

The core issue is simple: many companies see outbound as a numbers game focused on quantity over quality. But genuine connection is so critical!

  

Think about how often you open your inbox to find it crammed with messages from companies you don’t care about. Annoying, right?

  

Businesses are churning out content and outreach, but it falls flat because it’s so impersonal. And with more subpar digital tools automating everything, sales teams blast generic pitches to thousands with little success.

  

The result? Prospects feel overwhelmed by impersonal outreach, so response rates drop, giving outbound a bad reputation.

  

For outbound to really soar, your outbound sales approach needs an overhaul.

  

**The Benefits of an Effective Outbound Sales Strategy**
--------------------------------------------------------

Executed correctly, outbound sales are one of the most powerful strategies for keeping your pipeline full and closing deals. They let you directly contact potential customers and have meaningful conversations.

  

Effective outbound also enables you to:

  

*   ![](https://www.artisan.co/assets/blogs/list-item.svg)
    
    Build relationships with prospects before they even realize they need you
    
      
    
*   ![](https://www.artisan.co/assets/blogs/list-item.svg)
    
    Control the narrative and spotlight your unique value proposition
    
      
    
*   ![](https://www.artisan.co/assets/blogs/list-item.svg)
    
    Stand out from competitors by offering personalized solutions for pain points
    
      
    
*   ![](https://www.artisan.co/assets/blogs/list-item.svg)
    
    Save time and resources by targeting only qualified, bullseye outbound leads
    
      
    

  
When done right, outbound lets you engage leads on your terms and steer them through the buyer’s journey. It’s like having a blueprint to build strong relationships and promote your solutions.

  

Outbound sales can be effective when done right, and statistics back this up. Companies that don’t cold call [experience 42% less growth](https://about.crunchbase.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/01/Cold_Calling_Tips_Sale_Reps-V4.pdf?hubs_content=blog.hubspot.com%252Fsales%252Fsales-statistics&hubs_content-cta=Sales%2520Prospecting%2520Statistics)
 than those who do. [71% of buyers](https://www.rainsalestraining.com/blog/b2b-sales-funnel-stages)
 are open to talking to sellers when they’re actively looking for new solutions.

  

A stellar outbound sales strategy executed flawlessly can be an absolute game-changer for driving deals. Turn cold calling into warm conversations, and watch your pipeline heat up!

  

**What Does a Successful Outbound Sales Process Look Like? Six Key Steps**
--------------------------------------------------------------------------

![22](https://www.artisan.co/_next/image?url=https%3A%2F%2Fimages.ctfassets.net%2Fkyprwggh4muz%2F3RstkYKb1ZTseCbHaHhEVH%2F2033fb8f72b8a9d391e2a73cafdad937%2F22.png&w=3840&q=75)

While the approach varies from business to business, a generally successful outbound sales process will look like this:

  

### **Step #1 – Research and Identify Your Target Audience**

Before reaching out, it’s crucial to fully understand your ideal customer. Effective selling means grasping their desires and needs. The more intel you gather, the better you can customize your outreach.

  

This approach hugely benefits your sales reps, especially when dealing with diverse clients or a wide range of products/services.

  

Utilize data-driven research tools to pinpoint companies or people matching your target audience profile.

  

Market segmentation is key here, and you’ll need to ask critical questions like:

  

*   ![](https://www.artisan.co/assets/blogs/list-item.svg)
    
    Who is your target audience?
    
      
    
*   ![](https://www.artisan.co/assets/blogs/list-item.svg)
    
    What types of businesses are you aiming to sell to?
    
      
    
*   ![](https://www.artisan.co/assets/blogs/list-item.svg)
    
    Who are the decision-makers in these companies?
    
      
    
*   ![](https://www.artisan.co/assets/blogs/list-item.svg)
    
    Have you built a detailed buyer persona?
    
      
    

  
Without comprehensive answers, your team may lack the vital details to connect with the right folks. In fact, [42% of sales reps](https://spotio.com/blog/sales-statistics/)
 feel they don’t have enough information about prospects prior to making calls.

  

Do your homework and get crystal clear on your ideal customer. This level of insight takes your outbound efforts from generic to tailored, and you’ll know exactly how to resonate with each prospect and guide them to your solutions.

  

This is highly targeted outreach at its finest.

  

Tools like [Artisan AI’s Sales Reps](/ai-sales-agent)
 can help speed up this process. Ava, Artisan’s AI sales rep, comes with over 265 million built-in leads to help you create a targeted list of potential contacts.

  

### **Step #2 – Creating a Lead Database**

Alright, you’ve identified your dream customers. Now it’s time to gather their deets to connect with them. The best way is an organized lead database.

  

We know, databases sound boring. But having all your prospects in one searchable place is crucial for your sales reps. They’ll have everything needed to target the right folks and crush it.

  

We’re talking essential info like:

  

*   ![](https://www.artisan.co/assets/blogs/list-item.svg)
    
    Email addresses
    
      
    
*   ![](https://www.artisan.co/assets/blogs/list-item.svg)
    
    Phone numbers
    
      
    
*   ![](https://www.artisan.co/assets/blogs/list-item.svg)
    
    Social media profiles (primarily LinkedIn)
    
      
    
*   ![](https://www.artisan.co/assets/blogs/list-item.svg)
    
    Company name and website
    
      
    
*   ![](https://www.artisan.co/assets/blogs/list-item.svg)
    
    Job title and department
    
      
    
*   ![](https://www.artisan.co/assets/blogs/list-item.svg)
    
    Pain points they may have
    
      
    
*   ![](https://www.artisan.co/assets/blogs/list-item.svg)
    
    Other useful personal details (birthdays, preferences, etc)
    
      
    

  
And here’s a pro tip – treat your database like a garden, not a chore. Nurture it! Add new leads, update info, and weed out outdated contacts. This keeps your prospect list fresh and fertile for sales success.

  

Having this organized and up-to-date resource makes targeting and outreach way easier. You can filter leads by location, company, role, and more to create perfect outreach lists.

  

So embrace the database! It may not be sexy, but it’ll help you get results and forge great relationships.

  

### **Step #3 – Tailoring Your Outreach Messages**

When it comes to outreach, personalization is key to unlocking those lead connections. [According to](https://www.forbes.com/sites/blakemorgan/2020/02/18/50-stats-showing-the-power-of-personalization/?sh=3c1bfab42a94)
 _,_ 91% of customers are more likely to shop with brands that provide personalized recommendations and 80% of customers are more likely to make a purchase from brands that provide personalized experiences.

  

Every client and customer has different problems and goals. If you tap into those and show how you can make their life easier, you’ve got a winning lead on your hands!

  

Now we know what you’re thinking – personalizing every message would take forever. Sales reps already send so many emails; how can they customize each one?

  

Here’s the good news – it’s not as hard as it sounds with the right approach.

  

First, research each lead – their company, role, objectives, and pain points. Add these gems to your trusty database for easy access later.

  

Have a couple of outbound sales email templates ready, but use the intel to edit them and speak to each lead’s specific challenges. Provide tailored solutions based on what you’ve learned.

  

This shows you truly get them and have their back. Personal outreach brings meaning to your service and gets conversations started.

  

Effective outbound isn’t just about immediate deals. It’s about providing real value on topics prospects care about to build trust and loyalty over the long haul.

  

When crafting outreach, precision is key. Here are some tips:

  

*   ![](https://www.artisan.co/assets/blogs/list-item.svg)
    
    Keep it concise and scannable. Get to the value fast in case they’re busy. Use bullets!
    
      
    
*   ![](https://www.artisan.co/assets/blogs/list-item.svg)
    
    Include personal details like names, companies, and roles to show you customized your email. Studies prove personalization improves open and response rates. An Experian study showed personalized emails have a [29% open rate](https://www.linkedin.com/pulse/boost-your-open-rates-personalized-emails-key-successful-lisa-du-/)
     compared to an 18% open rate for non-personalized emails.
    
      
    
*   ![](https://www.artisan.co/assets/blogs/list-item.svg)
    
    Highlight unique value by addressing their exact pain points and goals upfront.
    
      
    
*   ![](https://www.artisan.co/assets/blogs/list-item.svg)
    
    Offer a clear CTA so they know the next step, whether booking a meeting, getting a demo, or subscribing to content.
    
      
    

  
The right balance of personalization and concise value is outbound magic.

  

Oh, and don’t worry if you don’t have the time or experience to do this yourself. Nowadays, you can use [AI Artisan Sales Reps](/ai-sales-agent)
 to handle everything on your behalf. Ava is trained to craft highly bespoke emails on behalf of your team. This gives you quality results without having to take up too much time.

  

### **Step #4 – Undertaking Outbound Sales Calls, Demos, and Meetings**

Alright, your personalized outreach is getting results – prospects are responding and ready to chat. Now it’s time to guide them through the sales journey with calls, demos, and meetings.

  

But here’s the key mindset shift: ditch the pitch and have an engaging conversation instead. Make it a two-way street!

  

Listen closely to understand each prospect. A mere [13% of customers](https://blog.thebrevetgroup.com/21-mind-blowing-sales-stats)
 believe sales reps can understand their needs. If you can be the sales rep who cares, you’re going to stand out from the bunch.

  

A personalized, thoughtful approach allows you to refine your offer so it stays tailored to the customer. The goal isn’t to pressure prospects into buying. It’s to build real connections through helpful education and valuable insights.

  

When you take the time to engage prospects, you build trust and show how your solutions can help them. This thoughtful approach nurtures fruitful long-term relationships.

  

So toss out the hard sell tactics. Successful outbound means focusing on the customer – listening first, understanding fully, and guiding gently toward solutions that are the right fit.

  

It’s all about that human connection. Build rapport, provide value, and the deals will happen naturally. Outbound is so much more effective when it comes from the heart.

  

Booking calls and meetings can be time-consuming, but Artisan AI Sales Reps can book meetings into your calendar at scale.

  

**_Pro tip_**_: Use call recording and transcription tools to analyze sales calls and pinpoint areas where you can improve._

  

### **Step #5 – Sealing the Deal**

After your personalized outreach, tailored conversations, and meticulous follow-ups, the prospect is ready to become a customer.

  

The big moment is here, and it’s time to seal the deal!

  

Remember, your mission now is to problem-solve. If the prospect has any lingering concerns, it’s your job to alleviate them.

  

You’ve put in the work to understand this prospect deeply. Now you need to guide them over the finish line, providing reassurance along the way.

  

Your persistence and consultative approach demonstrates that you’re committed to their success. When you keep their needs at the center, deals close themselves!

  

Here are some tips for effectively closing deals:

  

*   ![](https://www.artisan.co/assets/blogs/list-item.svg)
    
    Be confident yet flexible in your approach
    
      
    
*   ![](https://www.artisan.co/assets/blogs/list-item.svg)
    
    Understand the prospect’s decision-making process and adapt accordingly
    
      
    
*   ![](https://www.artisan.co/assets/blogs/list-item.svg)
    
    Emphasize the concrete benefits and ROI of your product or service
    
      
    
*   ![](https://www.artisan.co/assets/blogs/list-item.svg)
    
    Have pricing knowledge and be prepared to negotiate if needed
    
      
    
*   ![](https://www.artisan.co/assets/blogs/list-item.svg)
    
    Follow up regularly but avoid being too pushy
    
      
    

  
Or just let your trained, experienced AI reps do it for you.

  

### **Step #6 – Continuously Refine Your Outbound Sales Process**

Outbound sales are always evolving, so you’ve got to keep improving your approach. This means taking the time to stay on top of data, customer feedback, and industry trends.

  

Ways to step up your outbound game:

  

*   ![](https://www.artisan.co/assets/blogs/list-item.svg)
    
    Build that pipeline! Prospect regularly and follow up with leads. Nurture it like a garden.
    
      
    
*   ![](https://www.artisan.co/assets/blogs/list-item.svg)
    
    Make your messaging compelling and unique to each prospect. Get personal with it!
    
      
    
*   ![](https://www.artisan.co/assets/blogs/list-item.svg)
    
    Use tools like email automation, social media, and CRM to streamline things. Embrace the tech!
    
      
    
*   ![](https://www.artisan.co/assets/blogs/list-item.svg)
    
    Keep pace with industry changes and trends.
    
      
    
*   ![](https://www.artisan.co/assets/blogs/list-item.svg)
    
    Analyze results to find areas to boost. Let the data guide you.
    
      
    

  
Implementing these tips will enhance your current process and keep you ahead of the curve.

  

Feel empowered and confident to test new approaches and adapt. Never forget your goal is to provide value and forge lasting relationships.

  

Outbound excellence doesn’t happen overnight, but by optimizing relentlessly, you’ll get there!

  

**5 Impressive Sales Practices to Improve Your Outbound Efforts**
-----------------------------------------------------------------

![23](https://www.artisan.co/_next/image?url=https%3A%2F%2Fimages.ctfassets.net%2Fkyprwggh4muz%2F9fknYoWuwaEUeBJUFevZx%2F5bbbc341d9cf91b10a1f82579ca5823b%2F23.png&w=3840&q=75)

### **Be Customer Centric**

In a modern market, catering to customer experience is more important than ever. Customer-centric companies are [60% more profitable](https://blog.hubspot.com/service/customer-experience-trends)
. Putting customers first should be your north star – guide all efforts by it, especially above quotas!

  

A customer-centric approach means conducting thorough research to craft messaging that resonates deeply with each person. This demonstrates you truly understand their pain points and are committed to helping.

  

When you lead with empathy and service, you build incredible trust and loyalty.

  

Remember – prospects want to be seen, heard, and helped. Not targeted, pitched, and pressured. Keep the focus on making their lives easier and helping them reach their goals.

  

Customer-centricity is a mindset that shapes your whole approach. From initial outreach to closing the deal, always listen more than you speak. Seek to understand first, then to be understood.

  

Help first, sell second.

  

### **Leverage Social Media**

Social media is a major outbound sales hack. In fact, according to Hubspot’s [2023 Social Strategy Trends Report](https://blog.hubspot.com/sales/social-selling-stats)
, social media ranks third among the most effective sales channels. You can use LinkedIn, Twitter, and Instagram to connect with leads and build relationships like never before.

  

There are plenty of ways to do this, from sharing valuable content to engaging your audience, and showing your thought leadership.

  

The more value you provide, the more authority you have and the more leads you’ll attract.

  

However, the key is balance. Again, be helpful and insightful rather than salesy. Provide value without always pushing your product. Social media is about making connections through engaging content. Think long-form LinkedIn posts commenting on industry trends.

  

With time and effort, you can turn casual networking into meaningful conversations that convert leads.

  

Just keep it authentic.

  

### **Streamline Communications, Messages, and Scripts**

Having streamlined templates and scripts is crucial to ensuring consistent, effective messaging. It also allows easier training of new team members and saves time long-term.

  

But don’t just set it and forget it! Regularly optimize materials to improve clarity, relevance, and results. A/B test different versions. Update based on feedback. Tailor to new buyer personas. Add fresh examples and success stories.

  

Refined communications, messages, and scripts will take your outreach efforts to the next level. Put in the work upfront so each touchpoint moves smoothly forward.

  

### **Set Clear Goals and Track Progress**

Defining specific outbound sales goals is step one. Break each goal down into measurable metrics you can track daily, weekly, and monthly. Monitor key numbers like contact rate, prospect meetings set, deals closed, revenue generated.

  

Tracking progress gives you critical data to make smart improvements. Identify what’s working and double down on that. Find what’s not and switch up your approach.

  

Adjust your goals as needed and set reminders to analyze metrics regularly so you stay motivated and on track.

  

Outbound excellence is a marathon, not a sprint. With a clear roadmap and measurement system, you can achieve remarkable results.

  

### **Use Tools and Automation**

Technology has changed the outbound sales game! [76% of companies](https://explodingtopics.com/blog/marketing-automation-stats)
 now use marketing automation and 10% of customer journeys are actually _fully automated._ It’s easy to see why automation is becoming popular: 47% of CMOs say automation helps leads transition from marketing to sales faster.

  

Take advantage of tools and automation to streamline work and boost efficiency.

  

Email tracking, scheduling, automated follow-ups – these tools help you stay organized and focused on actually connecting with people.

  

AI and chatbots can also help greatly, with [48% of customers](https://blog.hubspot.com/service/customer-experience-trends)
 comfortable with interactions managed by bots or AI. Artisan AI Sales Reps can do a litany of tasks for your team from drafting personalized emails to booking meetings to responding to prospects’ questions.

  

However, you need to take time to set clear goals, track progress, and leverage tech wisely. Mindless usage gets confusing, messy, and will cause more harm than good, so always remember – tech should enhance human connections, not replace them. Lead with empathy and care.

  

Outbound is powered by people.

  

**How to Use Digital Tools to Acquire Outbound Sales Mastery**
--------------------------------------------------------------

While the strategies here will improve your outbound sales, it’s crucial to leverage digital tools and technology for maximum success.

  

The right tech stack empowers you to:

  

*   ![](https://www.artisan.co/assets/blogs/list-item.svg)

    Minimize mistakes that slow things down

    Organize the data flood into clear insights to guide your outreach
    
      
    
*   ![](https://www.artisan.co/assets/blogs/list-item.svg)
    
    Ultimately close more deals by leveraging tech’s potential
    
      
    

  
Here are some recommendations for getting started:

  

*   ![](https://www.artisan.co/assets/blogs/list-item.svg)
    
    Sales engagement software to scale personalized emails and track responses
    
      
    
*   ![](https://www.artisan.co/assets/blogs/list-item.svg)

*   ![](https://www.artisan.co/assets/blogs/list-item.svg)

The core of what we’re talking about here is making sure you’re listening to your clients and leads and identifying what their needs are, and then addressing those needs as quickly, as accurately, and as comfortably as possible.

  

Of course, this can be a lengthy and time-consuming process where you’re relying on humans to get it exactly right with every single instance of communication. Therefore, we recommend you let AI technology do the leg work for you, maximizing the ROI while minimizing the risk.

  

Adopt the right tools now and unlock your potential while staying genuine. Digital advancement plus personal connection is a winning outbound combo!

  

And on that note, take a look at our platform, Artisan AI, as an example.

There’s never been a better time to leverage AI technology and data for more personalized, effective sales outreach.
